Reviews.Title: Good product, but with some caviats
Reviews.Author: Devin
Reviews.Content: The good:-Extremely easy to setup, was up and running in well under 15 minutes including unboxing time.-Gateway grabs a DHCP address from your broadband router and connects to the my.vuezone site.-Smartphone clients for Android, iPhone and Blackberry devices. (Update: Blackberry is no longer supported)-Cameras are completely wireless, allowing for extremely easy installation-Cameras seem to have a very decent range from the gateway.-No line of sight needed for the cameras, no problems for me going through walls and floors of brick, wood and drywall. Metal building supplies may pose issues though, but this will be the case with any wireless camera.-1 year of Premium service comes with the system, currently only $49.95 per year after that.-Snapshots/videos are recorded out to the website immediately, and can be played back from almost any internet connected computer.The bad:-Motion sensing does not work through glass.-Cannot set ignore times for motion sensing/alerting, it is either on or off for each camera.-Low-light performance leaves much to be desired. Despite several streetlights, no picture was visible in an area easily visible to the human eye.-Operating temperatures limited to 32º to 122º F, so mounting options will be limited to temperature controlled locations for most locations. (Update: per Avaak Tech Support, this is a limitation of the batteries, not the camera.)-Cameras have no wired power option, so you'll be using up batteries even in areas where you could easily connect wired power.-Fixed 60 degree field of view on the cameras is a bit limiting.Overall, the system is good with a few caveats. With more camera options, it would be great. Unfortunately, it appears Avaak has gone the other way, as the Outdoor rated camera has disappeared from their site.I would love to see cameras with an AC power option, an outdoor rated dome camera (Pan/tilt/zoom would be outstanding) and perhaps others integrated into the great gateway and website that Avaak has going for them.Update:Outdoor (waterproof) camera mounts are now available! This doesn't address the temperature restrictions of the batteries, but gives you a lot more flexibility in the mounting location. Avaak has changed their service plans several times from when this review was written, so check the latest account details on their site. They also run sales on the service renewal from time to time, so renew when the sales are going to save yourself a few bucks.My concerns with eating through the batteries seems to have been unfounded, as I'm still on the original batteries in all the cameras. Also, the sticky-back on the mounts should be looked at as a BACKUP to the screw slot on all but perfectly smooth surfaces. I had a camera take a nasty 8 foot fall onto concrete which left a crack in the housing, but it still works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for basic use...
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: I have had my VUE SM2700 motion detection camera system up and running for about a week now, and so far so good! Installation really is a breeze, and the wireless cameras (and their mounts) are so convenient to use.  I have the receiver upstairs along with one of the cameras, and the other camera is downstairs.  Both cameras have perfect reception and the viewing resolution is better than I expected.  Also, there are three adjustable settings for the available lighting the room provides, which is accessed through the software so you can easily change the settings even when you are away.I tested the motion detection once, and it worked fine.  An email was immediately sent showing a video clip of the movement.  This can be adjusted from a 10 second or 40 second clip.  I will do more extensive testing at a later date, but so far it seems to work well.  The 2x zoom function also works well.  You get to decide what to zoom in on, and the resolution is excellent.  The movements on screen are a little laggy, but that is to be expected and really its not that bad at all.  If someone was removing something from your home, I think you would be able to get a clear shot at the persons face along some point of a 40 second motion video.  A lot also depends on how far you setup your cameras from the objects they may be viewing.  The brighter the available lighting and the closer the better.I have had zero issues using the software on a PC, IPAD, and on my Android phone.  They all three work perfect so far.  This is great news, something that actually works!So far I am very happy with this setup.  I will say that this is NOT a high end surveillance system so dont buy it with unrealistic expectations.  However, for basic home use I think you will be hard pressed to find anything better anywhere near this price range.  I only wish a future firmware upgrade will add a schedule setting that allows the motion detection to turn off/on at a certain time.  That way when you come home at 5pm everyday, you dont have to disable it manually.Otherwise, no real complaints!  Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: Subscription plan also required
Reviews.Author: DM
Reviews.Content: I have been using these cameras for several years and generally been pleased... until recently. This company is trying to now get me to pay for a yearly subscription to view my cameras on-line. I think this is a serious problem and it was not disclosed that I would need to purchase an additional service when I made my original camera purchase. I have three cameras in one location and to be frank, am not sure why I need to pay an additional $20 a year for something that was originally free and has minimal benefits. I have written to this company questioning this policy twice so far and have received unapologetic generic responses. I am very angry and am looking for another product to replace my VueZone.

Reviews.Title: Quick and easy set up but poor frame rate
Reviews.Author: Pikmin
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to set up the cameras and "gateway". No technical knowledge is necessary. The gateway has one USB port but the manual and web site do not mention any use of it. I wish the recorded video could be stored in a USB flash attached to the gateway. Lens are not wide-angle. To capture a view of entire room, the camera has to be placed high on the ceiling.I am not happy with the frame rate. Eight frame per second at 320 x 160? Come on, this is not in the 80s.A nice feature will be providing advanced functions by connecting to the gateway directly, just like you connect to the web site inside a Linksys router and change the settings. This feature may be present but hidden.Don't bother to view the camera at night. The FAQ web site says at least 40-watts light bulb is required. I tried it. The image was very grainy and painful to see.Overall, the product offers basic functions of live video camera. Make sure you have adequate lighting, or preferably in bright daylight. Online registration is quick and easy. I can view the camera immediately after registration. However, if your network is down such as no Internet due to ISP (Internet Service Provider) issue, you're doomed. You can't view the camera.

Reviews.Title: Beware, $50/year service fee almost required
Reviews.Author: J. Ying
Reviews.Content: Hidden fee warning: to use any mobile phone requires $5 / month fee. To share viewing with more than 1 person requires fees as well.  Many negative reviews seem to have been updated because the company threw a bone at these customers and extended free service by 1 year, and raised fees for all others who are buying now.If you read company rep's response to those negative reviews, it's a lie saying premium fee is required for maintaining quality of service. This camera should not be using any of the company's resources once installed at home, the fee is only good for keeping their profit and bonuses growing. I am a software engineer myself and I appreciate the need to make money, but requiring users to pay additional fee for some basic function that's highly touted in their product description is highly deceptive.I almost bought this camera since the design looks very nice and the gold box offer is tempting.Thanks to those who wrote 1 or 2 star reviews, I was able to see the proper warning. Since company now is engaging in trying to change those negative reviews to better by selectively offering additional benefits, I feel compelled to warn everyone else.Hope this will save some people's trouble having to pay the return shipping when realized that it does not work with phones out of box.

Reviews.Title: CHARGE ADDITIONAL FEE FOR iPHONE USERS
Reviews.Author: FRANK LU
Reviews.Content: It supported computer and iPhone surveillance in the beginning. However, a few days ago, it required you upgrade to "premium" membership in order to view though smartphones (like iPhone) which will cost additional $36.95 a year.I am pretty mad about this new rule. It claimed at first that this device will support smartphones (or at least let me believe so). However, it started to charge additional fees. My purpose is to see my dogs through iPhone wherever I go. Now I can only see from PC. I wouldn't have bought this if I had knew this change of rule that requires hidden fees. This company should tell us in the beginning that there are fees for smartphones, rather than starting to charge after my half year of ownership. I am starting to consider purchasing a Panasonic camera (I will never pay such a  "premium fee" for "additional" smartphone service).

Reviews.Title: Good home security system
Reviews.Author: wig121
Reviews.Content: I have been in law enforcement for over 35 years. Recently I purchased a condo in Florida. I was looking around for some type of security camera system for my condo that I could review over the internet. Having a second home I wanted to be able to view the cameras every day to make sure my property was secure from theft and/or damage from mechanical failure or weather related problems. Through my work I was involved with several projects dealing with camera web based technology, i.e., cameras in schools, malls, banks etc. that could be viewed by an officer from his car computer.These cameras are excellent, inexpensive and efficient little security devices that works well in my condo. First the setup is simple. The system comes with two wireless battery operated cameras, a network gateway with its own AC power adapter, four camera mounts for mounting your cameras, and an Ethernet cable. There is little computer system setup on the Vue network gateway. All you do is plug it into your router and synch the cameras. You are able to view immediately.I have recently purchased the new cameras that have motion sensors, which enables the cameras to automatically record videos or snapshots when they've been triggered by movements. Sensitivity for each camera's motion sensor can be adjusted on the web page. In addition to the recordings, I can receive e-mail notifications whenever motion is detected. Also I'm able to share the cameras with my family so they can view the property as well. I have recently recorded an alligator in the lake outside my patio window.Living over 3,000 miles away from my property in Florida and being able to view the cameras a couple of times a day makes our family feel more secure about our property.

Reviews.Title: Lousey support..... Unreliable camera performance
Reviews.Author: LukeyLu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 3 days ago.  I have a camera setup to view my backyard.  Battery 100%.  Camera working.I left town and am 400 miles away.  I log into myvuezone and nothing shows on my camera.I call tech support/customer service.  They say "you must resync the camera by moving it closer to the base station..."  I ask why I must 'resync' the camera if it was working before.  They don't know but will 'forward' my problem to the 'real' tech support who will get back tome in 24 hours (probably by email).The reality is there is no tech support.  There is only tech response by  email.  (support would be talking interactively to a knowledgeable person; not emailing every 24 hours back and forth)This camera is at best unreliable and inconsistent.  The tech support is non-existent.  If you need to rely on the camera or the company for consistent and reliable operation you should look at other cameras.  This camera and the company 'behind' it aren't setup to provide those needs.PS.  I just heard from Vuezone tech support.  They state that when sharing a camera link with someone else, if the other person 'forgets' to close their browser, it could run down the batteries and result in a dead camera.  This means that if you aren't at the camera location 100% of the time, you must 'educate' shared users about how to properly 'close' the camera viewing session so the battery isn't run down.  This makes a strong case for getting an AC powered camera.PSS.  Non working issue resolved.  I just got an email  (2 days after first contacted):  "We reviewed the data from your system and were able to replicate the same issue you described. While investigating the issue, it appears to have cleared. We are now able to log into your account and view your camera.The issue may have been resolved by a server maintenance that was performed last night."And this is their fix:  "Sometimes, as you may be aware, electronic devices may require a power cycle in order to refresh and get out of a bad state. If, in the future, you need to power cycle your gateway when you are not at the location of the gateway, we would be happy to ship you an automatic outlet or lamp timer to use with our gateway. "Really!  So imagine this: I am watching and recording an important event and then the lamp timer kicks in, resets the gateway and kills my recording and viewing while it 'restarts'.Dropcam Wi-Fi Wireless Internet Home Security Camera allows the user to turn on and turn off their camera via their view software.  I don't get why Vuezone can not do the same thing for their gateway?

Reviews.Title: Best Remote Camera System on the Market
Reviews.Author: Joseph Mark Raiteri "Mraiteri"
Reviews.Content: I have two systems in operation-one with 4 cameras and one with two camera.  One of the cameras is their new motion activate camera.  I tried several other types of systems to monitor my homes when I am away, but they were either too clumsy or too difficult to install and get them working.  I returned these and found the Vue.It is so simple to setup and operate and doesn't need line of sight to the gateway  (most systems do) - doesn't even need to be hardwired to a gateway; and a computer system is not required.  It is truly a wireless system; and each camera works the same as an intelligent laptop camera with WI-FI that can be controlled on your own designated web site with zoom and lighting adjustments by user.  Because it is battery operated, you don't have to locate it near a power outlet- really gives you lots of flexibility in where to locate your cameras.  Quality of the camera picture is excellent--as good as most hand held cameras.  If you have a wireless router, you just have to plug in the gateway and mount the cameras -- about as easy as hanging a small picture on a wall, it's that easy.Some insurance companies offer a discount on a home policy if you have a video monitoring system that can alert you if motion is detected; so the system could be paid for with Home insurance savings.  Excellent product and great support if you need it.  It is great to be able to check on my swimming pool when I am  away for weeks at a time.

Reviews.Title: Very easy setup, decent functionality - somewhat limited support
Reviews.Author: TangledUpNBigBlue
Reviews.Content: After much research into various types of video systems for monitoring my elderly father I finally chose the Vue system due to ease of installation and price. I researched several options including a hard wired security type system with DVR, IP network cameras and monitoring systems such as Logitech & Dropcam.The Vue system is incredibly easy to set up- you hook up the base station to your router, insert the batteries into the cameras push a sync button and that's it. Placing the cameras and aiming them actually takes much longer than set up but even that is easy & really doesn't take long just take your laptop to check the angles of the cameras and you're done. Setting up a Vue account is simple & quick too - create an account -set up motion detection, email alerts and etc. There is also an app for your Android, Iphone or Blackberry this too is quick and easy. Total time invested for system setup, camera placement and account setup & Android app setup for me was less than an hour. I recently added a third camera -again insert batteries, push the sync button & place the camera - 15 minutes or so -most of that was camera placement and aiming.The cameras are about the size of a roll of tape and most people don't notice them even when placed in plain site. The down side to the cameras is a narrow field of view. I have 2 placed in my dad's 10 x 12 bedroom and would need to add 2 more to capture all areas of the room. Note that there is no night vision capability, not a big deal for me but maybe for some.  We've had the system for 2 months or so with the cameras running 24/7 and the batteries still show full charge. I bought replacement batteries just in case - they run around $18 for ten.The VueZone app works great on my Samsung Vibrant phone I can access the cameras while on the go with ease. However, after installing the app on my wife's identical Vibrant she continually gets a "cameras disconnected" error when signing in on a "friend" account w/ permission to view the cameras. I have emailed VueZone about this & initially received several prompt responses (always within 1 business day) but have so far been unable to resolve even after removing & re-loading the app and following all other directions from Vue - finally they said they would consult their lab people and respond -it's been almost a month and no reply. I've sent follow-up emails which have been ignored. As with our IT guys @ work -silence usually means they're stumped & have chosen to hope I will go away.Similarly I am unable to view the cameras from my work PC but that's likely due to our firewall settings.This is a good, reasonably priced MONITORING system. If you want/need home security to be the primary function there are much better & more expensive choices out there. If you need to check on elderly family members, kids or pets remotely this is a viable, cost effective option - just be forewarned that their service & support has become somewhat suspect in my case.Update 8/12/11: 2 days short of 30 days since my last inquiry into the access issue on my wife's phone I received the following email from Vue Zone Support: "Thank you for your patience as we looked into your issue. We were able to reproduce the issue you are experiencing in our labs, and this bug has been escalated to our development team. Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention.Unfortunately, at this time there is no quick way to fix this issue. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience while our developers work on resolving this issue.VueZone Customer Support"On a positive note I must share that just this week I had a issue w/ one camera - the batteries ran down in minutes; replaced batteries they lasted about 10 minutes & died & motion detection quit working on all cameras - I emailed support @ 8pm on a week night & received a response within a couple of hours and was able to correct & re-set my system which is working fine once again.I share this in hopes it helps someone with their purchase decision.

Reviews.Title: Great concept, Epic fail
Reviews.Author: slinkywizard
Reviews.Content: I bought the full system with 4 cameras.  Unfortunately the product does not work as advertised and I had to return it.Pros:- Small cameras allow for discreet placement- No wires- Easy to mount camerasCons:- Poor image quality, slow frame rates, significant delay- The Android App for remote viewing on a smart phone functions properly only about 20% of the time- Viewing the cameras on a computer works only half the time, and of that half, usually only 2 or 3 of the 4 cameras work.  The system randomly fails to detect the other cameras.- Only 1 camera can be viewed at a time (technically multiple cameras can be viewed but doing so slows down the frame rate to the point of non-functionality)- Software updates malfunction (took 12 attempts to get 2 of the 4 cameras to update, the other 2 cameras still won't update)- Effectively non-existent tech support- Monthly fee to view the cameras, and the company's website is frequently down- The unreliable nature of the product makes it useless as a security camera- If the company goes under, the cameras become completely useless- Batteries seem to drain quickly, no option for AC power supply- No night vision- No pan, tilt or zoom option- Narrow viewing angle, takes too many cameras to get adequate coverageThis Vue system was a complete waste of money. I'm going to move on and try the Logitech system.  Wish me luck!

Reviews.Title: mostly worthless pile of expensive junk
Reviews.Author: Victor Christianson
Reviews.Content: I've tried using them at two properties for about two years and yes they are very easy to set up, but then very quickly they disconnect themselves and you have a worthless, expensive pile of junk. You cannot reset them up from a distance. So if you are watching a property from afar, when they stop working, you have to travel to the location to reset them. How long do they last? My experience is within a few weeks they are offline.

Reviews.Title: Easy, clever, and it works
Reviews.Author: Ruprecht
Reviews.Content: I had always had some sort of web cam system in the far recesses of my mind as something I'd like to have in the house, but was not actively shopping for one when I came across the lightening deal. I read all the reviews, so I knew exactly what to expect as far as the service plan requirements for most features, etc. With these things not being a surprise and having my expectation level appropriately set, I am really impressed so far with this little system.I received it the other day, and I didn't think I'd set it up until the weekend and thought I'd just open the box and have a look. Well, it was so ridiculously simple and quick to set up, I just went ahead and did it within the span of maybe 15 minutes. The trickiest part was placing/aiming the camera where I wanted since my computer is in another room and I kept going back and forth to see how I was doing. After some reading, I realized that having the camera running constantly would drain the batteries pretty fast (you don't want to just leave it "playing" and on a window on your computer or whatever; it's not like it's plugged into the wall, the batteries will drain doing that). Their website cites "normal" use as about 5 minutes per day, so take the hint.Yesterday was the first "test" day as I wanted to get alerts when my dog passed through the room. At first I set the video clips for 10 seconds, but I was getting bombarded with email alerts every minute (I hadn't realized my old dog was scampering around the house so much all day!). I changed it to 40 second clips, but I still got bombed with alerts. I'm going to have to experiment with the sensitivity settings or something so that I can leave the motion detector/alerts on for security purposes w/o having my little Jack Russell indirectly emailing me all day long.The video quality is better than I expected from reading other reviews. Yes, it is certainly not HD, but it's clear enough for the purpose. The iPhone app is actually pretty cool in my opinion and I think they've probably sold me on signing up for the service plan. When I bought this system, I expected to be happy with the free basic service. I don't think what they are charging is exorbitant, and you can't really expect them to give away storage space, etc. for free. I guess I feel better about it than some because of the great lightening deal I got, and that I didn't used to get these services for free before they started charging. I can imagine I would be irritated by that.I plan to test this out just a bit longer, then will probably add at least one more camera. I will put one in my kids' upstairs play room to be able to take a quick peak at them when I think they may be up to no good. Also considering one for aiming at the front door, either from inside or from a sheltered area outside.I would say this has surprisingly met my high expectations. I was prepared for a letdown, but it hadn't come yet.

Reviews.Title: So far so good - But at what risk?
Reviews.Author: Randy M "rdm"
Reviews.Content: ***** And still another update 1/25/12 *****New issue. Now the vuezone website is down A LOT !!!!!Msg "none of your camera's are available".Verified this was vuezone.Tech support IS AWFUL!!!!They answer the phone, but just the same-o "we will forward your concern to our tech dept. Someone should call you back TOMORROW?".I am truly SORRY I was conned into buying into these joke of a system.Anyone for a class action lawsuit???******* ANOTHER UPDATE 1/14/2012 *********Well, I did not return them after all. I stuck with it, having no other reliable options available.And things have improved greatly!Only 1 web downtime in the past month, and that was for only 1 hour for maint (a popup message displayed).The camera pricing has dropped a bit. And new lower membership pricing. Both get A+ for improvement.I have to add this monitoring system is very good. Especially reliable using my iPhone.I will change my original star rating from 2 stars to 4. Would earn 5 stars if 100% security system, which they aren't, naturally.And I now "would" recommend this system/cameras for casual home or site monitoring.The system is very functional and I am still on the original batteries getting full meter levels.Not for high security needs, but for casual monitoring this system is worth the cost. Smart phone support is the major advantage.Yes... I can now easily recommend this system for giving a little peace of mind while away from the home.I have never once had to recycle the system or cameras. They always work as long as the web is up.The system has always recovered on its own, after a home power outage due to a few bad storms.The system has always come back online "ON IT'S OWN" as soon as the power and internet was back up. 5 stars for that !!!I now plan to add more camera's very soon!Vuezone very much is option to try or consider for casual monitoring.And they have added a optional cam-shell add-on for purchase, for I guess camera protection adding outside monitoring.Vuezone obviously is working hard and attentive to make a very good system even better.***** UPDATE 11/18/11*********Not only is the vuezone web down quite a lot, it is also taken offline often for maint. Again... totally unacceptable. The vuezone camera system is nothing more than a toy. Un reliable for any type of security monitoring. When the site is down, cameras are useless. And the site is down "A LOT". Add to that, vuezone has the nerve to actually charge a monthly fee.******* UPDATE 10/13/2011 ***********I am finding the vuezone website is down several times throughout the night on many occasions.Due to this, the cameras are naturally non accessable remotely. This is totally unacceptable!!!!!I will be returning my camera system to amazon.I was afraid of this happening when using a system that relies on access through the company website.Any site maintenance that causes loss of access to the camera system is totally unacceptable. Period!!!I expect =ZERO= down time on the part of any company where camera access is only possible using the website.*************************************I've tried many web enabled camera's for home monitoring. None work as advertised. Usually some connection issues or camera dropping offline and needing a reboot. Not possible when away from home, naturally. D-Link web camera's are one of the many that totally fail at reliable home monitoring. And I've tried them all.This vuezone system, so far, has been reliable using my iPhone-4 with 3g connection and the vuezone iphone app.System setup was not smooth, however. After connecting the receiver to the router, the camera's failed to connect. Only after unplugging the receiver unit and doing the opposite of what the instructions say to do, did the cameras connect.So far remotely, the system has connected via my iPhone and offered reliable monitiring. But this system is way too costly for what it's worth. The 2 camera + receiver unit system should sell at half the asking price. No live audio. And the video goes thru, and relies on the vuezone company website to furnish your video from your home location to your viewing location. So I wonder what happens if vuezone goes belly up in the future? All these systems will be worthless? Since the system relies on vuezone to relay your video?A little scary if you ask me. Especially for the high cost of the system and the fact you also have to pay a monthly membership to vuezone for anything beyond basic camera services.Not good!This is your risk to consider... Investing in a costly limited video monitoring system, plus paying beyond that a monthly fee for premium service, then hoping the company is still in operation one or two years down the road. The whole thing sounds a little like a gimmick to me. Selling low end video hardware at high end prices, then having the whole system only operational as long as the company is in business. If vuezone fails to remain in business, you will be stuck with hundreds of dollars in useless paper weights.The system, as a remote monitoring system via phone apps, is so far working fine for me. But I have to weigh if the future risks with this investment is really worth it in the long run. I have 30 days to decide via the Amazon return policy, thank goodness.PS. I have to add the fact that these camera's are battery, no wires at all, does make the system user friendly in that you get 4 wall stickem's (magnets) with the camera kit, where the little camera sticks to it magnetically. So if you need a camera here, or there, depending on the day or monitoring need, it is simple to grab the camera off it's magnet mount in one room, and take to it another room and stick it in that room on the magnet mount. Just grab and stick up. What could be easier?Plus... the "ball" stickem magnet mount makes it simple to adjust the camera view angle. No hardware or screws to mess with. It's a camera with a magnet that sticks to a round wall stickem-up ball magnet. So easy to adjust the viewing angle. And while I have a fairly large home (3 levels) the camera's have kept connection to their base no matter what room in the house I placed a camera. That was a plus for me.Battery operation for some may be a drawback. I find it to be very functional and user friendly mounting system. Just stick the camera where you need it for the day/night via the magnetic connection wall mount. You get 4 wall mounts, so you can place the wall mount in the 4 rooms where monitoring is needed most.Wall mounts can either be attached with the sticky peal-off back, or hung on a wall screw. The little camera's also have a flat bottom base, so it can be set flat on a table or shelf. And because the camera's are totally wireless (battery operated), you have no nearby power supply or wall outlet issue to deal with.NOTE: For a battery operated camera system, and with Wi-Fi, this is no doubt the most convenient monitoring system you will come across. That is until the battery dies.HOWEVER... the company claims a 6 month battery life under normal use. And as a PLUS I might add, is the iPhone or computer live monitoring screen also displays a battery level meter, so you know where the battery life stands.The live battery meter display makes up for the possible short comings of using a battery operated camera system.You can easily tell when time is at hand to change the battery's. Of which each camera does take 2 batteries.Amazon sells a 10 pack for under 20 dollars. "DL123A DURACELL ULTRA LITHIUM PHOTO BATTERY"

Reviews.Title: Awesome! Cat-TV!
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: This camera system is so easy to set up and SO easy to use! We were looking for something so we could keep an eye on our cats while we're gone and it does just that. They only turn on when we log into look at them so they are not running all the time and wasting batteries.I have the option of turning on the motion sensing for when I'm on vacation and have other people coming in to take care of them. You can set the sensitivity of the motion detection, the light affecting the camera, and zoom all from the internet or your smart phone.The cameras are battery operated so there are no cords or wires! They mount magnetically to the little domes that you put on the wall so you can move the cameras around as you please.It is so nice to be able to check on them while we're gone and have peace of mind that they have everything they need. When it comes to no-nonsense home security and monitoring... It is SO easy to use! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: EZ EZ EZ setup camera system
Reviews.Author: B. menendez "bm"
Reviews.Content: this is the camera system i've been waiting for. I have  two other IP cameras that i was never able to view over the internet. The port forwarding part always was a sticky situation for me in addition to the outdated software/firmware for the cameras i had.I knew someday a computer programmer would automatically do all of the port forwarding and settings through my router and they finally have.Pros1. EZ EZ EZ setup, no programming or even a computer necessary2. no wires to run3. really EZ cool magnetic swivel mounts with tape backing4. motion sensing camera recordings with email notification5. up to 25 cameras can be used6. recording stored offsite at Vuezone and can be downloaded later7. droid app that works fine with my phone or you can view cameras straight off the browser, either way.cons1. since it is wireless, picture resolution will not be premium, don't expect commercial resolution2. since it is wireless and battery operated, distance from wireless router is very limited, make sure your specific situation (i.e. mounting distance from your wifi) is sufficiently close for two way communication.I'm sure this system is not for everyone, but it works great for me. I have the motion camera mounted on my front door so that whenever someone comes to my front door, they are recorded and an email is sent to both my droid phone and my other email accounts with the recorded video event.I'm going to buy two more systems, one for my office and one for my parents house

Reviews.Title: very easy to set up, nice resolution, would like more features.
Reviews.Author: M. Wolf
Reviews.Content: Other reviewer have commented how easy this is to set up.  WOW they were right.  I've already got my non-tech oriented husband set up to view the cameras using his android phone (okay I had to install it for him but he can now use it on his own).The camera set up was easy, connecting the receiver to the router was easy, getting on to the web site and creating an account linked to my product was a complete breeze.  Getting the cameras set at the right angle was probably the most complicated thing and even this was very easy -- especially with the ability to have a cell phone right at the site of the camera to ensure the angle is right without having to run back and forth to the computer.The camera's are much smaller than a previous system I have used.  I like this because they are not as easy to see so people may not know they are being monitored.  I still keep the bigger one up and plugged in as a decoy.Things I wish were present1. the ability to stream directly to my computer and record directly to my computer or external hard drive.2. ability to remotely control panning3. better low light resolution / infrared technology for night or dimly lit areas4. a more common battery type -  I use rechargeable AA/AAA batteries.  This are odd batteries and not rechargeable.  :/ (not happiness)5. outdoor rated cammerasOver all though I'm impressed and like the price point compared to other products with similar features.The ease of set up goes a long way.  This is one of the easiest gadgets to install that I own and by far easier to intall than the previous "wireless" system I have used.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: CnG
Reviews.Content: This system is very easy to setup and use.  I use it at my office and home to keep an eye on everything and it works great.  The motion detection is great to watch areas for activity and to be automatically notified of the activity (like the front door).  I HIGHLY recommend this product for its ease of use and setup.  The only thing that would be better is to be able to have cameras that can be turned remotely but it is a great product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Needs paid subscription for use with smartphone
Reviews.Author: Rubens
Reviews.Content: The product itself is good. No pan/tilt but decent image quality, ok frame rate. Installation is very easy and quick. However, the main reason I bought it was the Iphone support and only after opening the box I learned you need the $45/y subscription to use it (I know... I should have done better research, but this was a lightning deal impulse buying). The first 30 days were free and I really found this camera helpful. Since I refuse to pay for such service I rarely use it now.

Reviews.Title: If you have unreliable wifi, you'll love this system
Reviews.Author: KCinDC76
Reviews.Content: I have tried other of these types of products.  I own and still use the Archerfish Solo Wireless Intelligent Video Surveillance System with Built-In DVR which is a great system, but the problem is that my WiFi is unreliable, meaning that many times the camera doesn't work correctly because the signal between it and my WiFi was unreliable. I've had the same issue with another camera I've owned Panasonic BL-C131A Network Camera Wireless 802.11 and no longer use. So, those network camera systems may be great products, but they couldn't work well with my unreliable WiFi.In terms of picture quality, the videos and pictures don't look great on a large monitor, but on a mobile phone, or even an iPad, they look fine.  Most important, I can see what I need to see.The reason why this VueZone camera system works better for me is that it has its own router, which is connected to my router via Ethernet (not wirelessly).  The communication between the cameras and the router seem to be flawless.  While other WiFi devices in my home don't work well, this product does.  For that reason alone I give it five stars - it does what it says it does.

Reviews.Title: Great Product Serves The Purpose
Reviews.Author: DJeterfan
Reviews.Content: I did plenty of research before settling on the VueZone system.  My girlfriend and I recently purchased 2 twelve week old puppies. They are left in a large pen for much of the day.  The camera allows us to check in on them during the day.  Motion sensor and zoom features are reliable and sufficient.  I don't understand the complaints of some of the people regarding this product. Their expectations were apparently too high. For the price and purpose, this is a great system. If you are looking to monitor a large area or perform 24/7 surveilance...then you need to invest in a more expensive and elaborate system.  We simply want to be able to observe our puppies a few times an hour to see that they are okay. One complaint...the web service doesn't work.  However, the Iphone App is 95% reliable.  The few times we get booted off, we are able to get back in quickly.  I strongly recommend the product as it provides great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: all about the up sale
Reviews.Author: M. Turner "Wolf Pack Fan"
Reviews.Content: Be advised this product works great initially.  But you will be bombarded with emails to sell you monitoring services, and shortly after the 90 day return period you will no longer be able to use motion detection, multiple cameras, or a phone application for monitoring.  So basically after you buy this product you can view your camera from within your home.  I'm less than thrilled.  Buy something else that does not try so hard to tie you into a monitoring services fee.

Reviews.Title: Great idea but needs work, limited usability
Reviews.Author: IR
Reviews.Content: VueZoneThe VueZone is a great piece of hardware.  It is very easy to use and install.  Why did I give it one star you ask,  because the software needs improvement and the fee's charged to use it are ridiculous given it's limitations. The free service allows only 2 cameras and no alerts or mobile phone access. The next level is good for only for 5 cameras.  This is not enough even for a modest home give the limited viewing angle.  Here is where they are shooting themselves in the foot.  If you allow at least 10 cameras for the basic paid plan, you will sell more hardware and give customers a more useful system.  I don't see how anyone will be whiling to pay for the premiere service that allows more cameras but is too expensive. On the bright side I do like that you can set it up to record video when motion is detected.  You will receive an email with a link to the video.  This is great because if someone does break into the house the video is stored safely in the cloud.  Another big problem is that the cameras do not automatically adjust themselves to light.  This is a big problem because if you set it up for night view you get a washed out picture during the day and if you set it up for bright light you get no picture at night.  The manufacturer has not plans to fix this issue.  Also, it would be nice to have a way to quickly turn motion on or off on all cameras at the same time.Pros1. Very small2. Long battery life3. Completely wireless so you can place it just about anywhere and move it as needed4. Very long range5. Motion detection works well6. Can be setup to record to the cloud when motions is detected7. Great customer supportCons1. Limited viewing angle, no wide angle camera offered at this time2. Monthly fee required for it to be usable3. Very limited space to store your video in the cloud unless you pay more, download or delete it4. No automatic exposure adjustments, must be done manually5. No iPad app even when in their advertisement they show one6. No outdoor camera offered at this time7. Limited picture quality8. Video quality is not fluid but acceptable9. No rechargeable batteries come with the system but they can be purchased elsewhereThis system has great potential once the cons have been addressed. I hope they are reading all the negative feedback.  For now mine is going back.

The cameras are still going strong, working well and I finally signed up for the premium service for $5.47 with tax. I'm very pleased with this product and service. Thanks Netgear!Ordered the VueZone System with one camera to feel secure in a sketchy neighborhood. For the price, I'm impressed it works. Everything was in the box (I read reviews that the batteries or cord was missing). The batteries, ethernet cord, camera mounts, camera and receiver (router) arrived in the box, brand new.VueZone's website has online directions for setting up the camera. The system is very easy to set up for anyone. No technical experience is needed (in my opinion). You plug in the receiver with provided power cord and connect the ethernet cable to your router, place the provided batteries into the camera and sync. Very easy. The clarity of the video is good. It's not hd, but you can see faces and it's a better picture than expected. The phone app is available from Google Play off VueZone's website and works with the Boost Samsung Prevail Galaxy (reviewed). Took me less than ten minutes to the open box, read the directions and get the camera working online.The camera system earns bad reviews because of the service plans. I understand people being dissatisfied their cameras are (now) requiring payment to operate. This does not affect the basic service (allows one camera to be viewed on a computer). It's up to the individual to decide if paying for the extra cameras and phone app is worth the money. The rates are NOT super expensive.A sticker for the area being monitored (such as ADT gives their customers) needs to be included or offered. Would be awesome to let people know they are being recorded and broadcasted. The program needs updating and connecting issues fixed. The camera disconnects when another program is opened (sometimes). Basically, you can view your camera but do nothing else on your computer. A good programmer can fix that snafu. There's not too much visibility at night. A night vision camera would be the best addition to VueZone's two camera models.Overall it's REALLY easy to set up and gets a good picture. You can move the camera around without being strangled by cords and view it on your phone. Cool to me so far. I'll update this review after using the camera for a while.

Reviews.Title: works great!
Reviews.Author: F. Art Flowers
Reviews.Content: This motioncam is perfect for the non techie.  Easy setup., simple operation ,. Well worth the extra cost for the internet monitoring. The app for my android phone works great. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Excellent for Nanny Cam
Reviews.Author: JAH1JAH1
Reviews.Content: The camera is basic VGA resolution and the service is handy when you're out and about.  The other option is to guess what it going on when you're gone.  I'll take the lower resolution and forgo the risk.Worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: Great product for easy home monitoring
Reviews.Author: Fred Wang
Reviews.Content: We use this system for monitoring our yard.  Very easy to set-up, great iPhone integration, and addictive to see what's going on.  We've had deer problems in our yard eating our rose bushes, set up the camera with the motion sensor and get emails whenever we have an unwanted guest in our yard.  We now have 5 cameras on the system and it's been a great solution for us.  Note - the resolution on these cameras aren't like a webcam, but for a battery-powered camera that goes for months without replacing the battery, you can't expect any better!

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: meechee "Screen Goddess"
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot throughout the year and it's tough when I have no idea what's going on with my home when I'm away.  Companies that specialize in home security want lots of money to set up a viewable home monitoring system if they even offer one at all.  I decided to wait until I could find something that would work for my needs.  The VueZone system seemed to fit the bill.  When Amazon had the VueZone on a goldbox deal, I decided to roll the dice and see how it worked.  Truth be told, when the system arrived, I stuffed it into a cabinet and forgot about it for a month or more because I wasn't in the mood to goof around with it.  Most technology doesn't work properly right out of the box and I didn't have time to troubleshoot any problems.  When I finally did get around to pulling the system out and setting it up, it literally didn't take me more than 5 minutes.  This couldn't be any easier.  I plugged the base unit into the wall and my router.  I put the included batteries into the camera and pressed a button on the base unit to sync the camera with the base unit.  I then found a place in my home to put the camera.  The kit comes with several "ball" wall hangers.  You just peel the plastic off the back and stick it anywhere you like (they do caution you about the adhesive possibly messing up your walls, but I believe they have adhesive removers to handle such issues).  You'll have to log on to VueZone online to set up an account and choose your level of service.  You can either get the free service which supports two cameras, or the premier service which supports 5 camera.  I got the premier service on sale for $36 for the year.  Once online you can view your camera right away and the pictures are cystal clear and fantastic!  I'm so pleased with a product that delievers just what they promise.  I can now leave town and not only check in on my home from my computer, but from my android smartphone as well!  I have three cameras in various places inside my home and two cameras positioned at the front and back door.  I can always get a clear picture as long as the lights are on.  One caveat I'd give to anyone considering purchasing the product, the cameras do not pan around or move in any way so be sure to pick a good spot that covers the most space to get the biggest bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: Bait and pay camera system
Reviews.Author: fanmailer
Reviews.Content: Not happy! I bought the first VueZone camera and wireless base 2 years ago with an additional camera at over $275. I had every intention of expanding later to 4 cameras if it met my needs, which I did a year later, at another $100 each. There was no warning that these cameras were only useable for 1 year before the company would "turn off" two of them unless I subscribed for a 4 camera setup with an annual fee. This was not disclosed up front when I bought the system 2 years ago. Now I have two "disconnected" and useless cameras unless I pony up.  Two dead cameras, poor frame rate, expensive batteries, and expensive service plan...I feel ripped off.  If you must have it, just buy the two camera system ONLY.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with a warning about the additional cost to use all of its features!!!
Reviews.Author: Busymomonthego
Reviews.Content: First...the warning (visit their website and read thoroughly before purchasing):I purchased two of the motion censored cameras to monitor the activity in my home while I'm at work (I have a teenager...).  Set up was quick and very easy which is a great thing...but...make sure you read everything thoroughly before purchasing because there is a catch!  The advertisements talk all about the systems great online features and how you can view it from your smartphone and add up to 15 cameras, etc....but read very carefully because in order to access these features, you must pay an annual fee.  The basic service only allows you to sync up to 2 cameras and you can only view the cameras from your computer.  You need to pay their premier or elite fees in order to add additional cameras, receive any alerts or use any of the cameras features.  Here's the link to their service plans: [...]The pros:Again, set up was really fast and easy!  The cameras themselves work great and the picture quality is really good for the price.  With the annual premium service package, I like that I can login anytime and take a video or a snapshot, even if the motion sensor wasn't triggered.  One of my big concerns was that I would waste my online memory space because I have 2 cats and I thought they would trip the sensors all day...but they didn't.The cons:I wish the cameras would come with rechargeable batteries instead of regular ones.  The battery life doesn't last very long and since I am using mine 5 days per week....those batteries can get expensive.  (They don't take regular AA  or AAA batteries)  Make sure you know where you want to place the mounts before sticking them because I made a mistake and when I tried to peel it back off....it ripped the paint clean off.  The stick very well!  The view is a bit narrow which was a slight disappointment but not enough for me to not use the cameras.  It is a bit of a pain to have to turn each camera on and off morning and night.  It would be nice if they included a shut off feature in that premier package we have to pay for.  The only other problem I found is when the camera is activated.  Maybe I misread the product slightly but I didn't realize the camera will will only take about 3-4 snapshots when someone walks in its range and because we walk somewhat fast, we appear blurry.  The surroundings are perfectly clear but depending on where you place the camera, you may not capture anything in the image unless there is a large area for a person to walk....long enough for the camera to capture something.  If you pay for the premium service, you can log online and take a snapshot or a video from your cameras at anytime but the video feature only works when you login and click it.  Otherwise, it's just those little quick snapshots.

Reviews.Title: I Spy
Reviews.Author: D. Wortham
Reviews.Content: Summary: Very simple to use. Very quick setup. Very little technical knowledge needed. No sound. Video quality good overall but not good for detail. Frames per second poor - from 1fps to 8fps. So expect choppy video. Resolution is 640x480. Not super bad but far from excellent. There is a higher resolution but it doesn't look like it is available with the current router. Cell phone usage is where it shines. Verdict: recommended with reservations and conditions.I've been interested in getting a security camera system for a while now so when this became available for free to review on the Vine program I eagerly selected it.The good:  Setup is very easy. The out of box experience is really very good. Everything you need is in the box including the batteries to run the wireless cameras. You must have a router (your dsl modem or cable modem) with a port free to use with the included camera router.Pairing the camera(s) with the router is a snap. You can tell that the company put a lot of thought into making this as pain free as possible and they succeeded admirably.I was viewing my remote camera within minutes of opening the box - 10 minutes tops!Some of the things I've been using my camera system for: Keeping an eye out for the family coming home loaded with groceries I need to go help unload; watching for the UPS guy; seeing if the dog wants back in; etc...Let me touch on a few of the things I think are bad:1 - video is choppy. The frame rate is about 3 to 4 frames a second. So, while you can see things and people moving for real security where you need smooth video this system isn't adequate. For you paranoid parents out there spying on the babysitter with this level of frame rate it is entirely possible you'll miss the slap and just see the move to and away from the now crying child. This is something Vue is working on so if that is your need you might contact them before purchasing - ask them about frame rates.2 - video takes at least 5 seconds to start playing if you are trying to start the live feed. Not really a big deal just something to note.3 - viewing from the computer browser is highly annoying. There are two sizes to view, danged small and full screen. What that means is that you cannot do anything else while viewing the camera on your computer. The way the web page is designed, even if you have the camera in its own browser window you cannot reduce the window size to just the camera view port so it still takes up a lot of screen space. I have a 23inch LCD monitor. The thing is the small view doesn't show much detail. The full screen view shows quite a bit of detail but it really is full screen, no borders or anyway to scale it down.4 - motion sensor. Depends on what you'll be using it for. It is a heat based sensor so the cat may not set it off. It can detect humans up to 15 feet away. But I'm not sure how the outdoor camera would work on a hot day and my kit only came with two indoor cameras. If this feature is important to you then you should contact Vue before you purchase and explain what you need so you can be sure this system will meet your needs.5 - you *must* view the camera across the internet at their website. There is no way to view it without using the internet. That may be important if you have an ISP that really, greatly, restricts data usage. Given the frame rate I don't see the data usage as a real issue but if your internet access is down for any reason your cameras are effectively off line.6 - yearly fee. You get a free membership with the purchase of the system. You cannot record video with the free membership but you can always view a live feed. They have one paid membership level, currently about $50 and a higher feature level membership in the works for about $100. Both are yearly fees so pretty reasonable I think.---Okay those were the things I didn't like or took note of that may affect your decision to buy.Based on those things I was prepared to give this system 3 stars.Did I mention that you can view the camera feed on your smart phone? No? Well, I didn't find out till recently that it was possible for my phone. You see, their website lists about 6 phone models and my andriod LG Optimus M wasn't one of them. I just assumed that they knew what their software would run on.Turns out they don't know. I looked them up in the Android marketplace, found the app and installed it. Viola!How to go from 3 stars to 5 stars in one simple step: Make it available for smart phones.This is where the system really shines! It solves the problem of not being able to do anything else while viewing the camera on the computer because you can just set your phone to the side and keep an eye on the camera while you continue working at the computer.When you are at the house and want to view the camera you don't have to use the computer. So, if you are doing the dishes you can keep an eye on the kids without having to have your laptop on the counter where it might get wet or fall off.When you are away from the house, and really that is when you most want to see what is going on, you just log in and within 30 seconds or so you are seeing what's happening. Very cool.You can arm the motion sensor or trigger a recording from your phone. You can start and stop live viewing.One thing about the smart phone app, at least on my android phone, you need to hit the sub-menu key and tap the 'log out' menu choice. Otherwise next time you open the app you will just get a dark screen or an error message about failing to connect.So, all in all, for the price I think it is a wonderful entry level system into the world of remotely keeping an eye on things. Carefully consider what you'll be using the camera for and look at some of the things I noted as possible drawbacks and make an informed decision. If the bad things I pointed out are not an issue for you then I think you'll enjoy having this system.

Reviews.Title: Easy ...VERY EASY
Reviews.Author: James F. Snider "Jim"
Reviews.Content: Yes this is not perfect but I gave it 5 stars.  Why?  Very easy to setup.  I took it out of the box and and had it working in 5 min. Then I went and stuck YES STUCK (no drill or tools) the cameras up and BAM they worked.  I have a problem getting WIFI in one of the rooms but the camera signal worked in that room. Because of the plug and play ability alone I give it 4 stars and the other star is because I like it.I have now gone on the web site and signed up for a year of service (you get one month free) and ordered two more cameras. I set up the motion camera to email me when there is motion so anyone walks into the room I have it set up to send instant email on my iPad and bag I click on the app and I can see what is going on. Even set it up to save the 40 sec video online so if they take all the equipment I have a copy online.So just think how cool it is to be out of your house and your iPhone/iPad dings at you and you check the email to see "motion in garage" you then check the App or open the email to the view the video of your son coming home early from school. That took about 30 sec tops from motion in house to you knowing what was going on.  Priceless. Then you text him to please shut the garage door. Speechless.This is not HD video quality recording .... It is I see someone in my house that should not be there so I call 911 quality video.I have used several hard wired security video systems and yes the quality is great on some of those but for a home security system this is great.  I don't need a computer or DVR left on 24/7 and just a small device next to my router and I am  monitoring my home 24/7.I just got this so time will tell the long term quality of this equipment, but out of the box I am very impressed.  I will update if I have any problems in the future.PS I usually don't waist time posting reviews so this thing has really impressed me today.

Reviews.Title: Argh!!!
Reviews.Author: Elg
Reviews.Content: After the latest software update, the iPhone app no longer works. See the iTunes store reviews as MANY people are having this problem. Essentially, my system no longer works. I contacted Netgear and tried all their suggested fixes. Unfortunately, none of the work!! Very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the $!
Reviews.Author: Aimeelieu
Reviews.Content: When I researched the type of camera and functionality I needed VueZone kept coming up. I was hesitant to believe I'd get everything I needed and be able to access it everywhere I wanted for such a low price but I was.  VueZone has given me the piece of mind I needed by providing a quick and realtime view of my home and family when I can't be there. Now when my kids say everything is fine I know it's true because I can see them. Whether I'm at work, in the car, or in another state VueZone has been there. It's always available whether I'm on my iPad, iPhone, Android phone, or Vizio Android Tablet. It always works!  I'll be adding 3 more cameras by summers end. VueZone has changed our lives!

Reviews.Title: So Easy and So CLEAR!
Reviews.Author: J. Hering "Bird Lady"
Reviews.Content: These cameras are fantastic. It took me only 20 minutes to sync them up, download the updates(very important) stick them where you want them and you're on ! It's amazing how small they are, and the picture is so clear. And you can zoom in to get a closer picture on your iphone or computer. If you are looking for an easy but quality webcam these should be on your list.

Reviews.Title: Bait & Switch - requires monthly $ to use mobile app or more than 2 cameras
Reviews.Author: P. Heller
Reviews.Content: The good news:  * Very easy to set up.  * Decent image quality in indoor-lighting useThe bad news:  * The box talks about the mobile app, which was my intended use, but this requires a $5/month subscription  * More than 2 cameras requires $5/month fee - didn't know about these fees until I set up the device.  * Low frame rate - adequate for casual monitoring but a throwback to olden times  * You can view only one camera at a time.  Switching to a different camera stops the one you've been watching  * Motion sensor doesn't work through glass and where it does work you turn it on/off manually - you can't set up a schedule.  * Very limited exposure range.  Exposure has to be set manually.  If looking outside, can't handle a sunny day.My take:  I'm feeling cheated because when I bught it there was no mention of monthly fee for a 'Premium' subscription that allows use of mobile app or more than 2 cameras.  Disappointed by weak handling of high and low light level situations and by inability to watch multiple cameras at once.  Not well suited for watching deck/driveway/etc. through a window.  The Amazon writeup does mention the fee for use of the mobile app now.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to set up, basic video survellience
Reviews.Author: Missy
Reviews.Content: I wanted to set up camera monitoring inside my house so I could keep an eye on my dogs when I'm gone.  Viewing remotely from a cell phone was a must.I also didn't want to spend $1,000, and didn't want to have to run wires or deal with complicated installation.So, I saw the VueZone on sale for approx $180 w/ 2 cameras, and figured I would give it a shot.Installation is SUPER easy and only took me 10 minutes.  The camera mounting system is great.  You just stick a round magnetic base anywhere on the wall, and the camera attaches to it with a magnet, so you can easily move the camera around on the base to change the view of the room.  I was easily able to get a full view of each room.  Before mounting, you just hold each camera near the base and push "sync" and the cameras are automatically synced to the base.  The base connects to your router/modem via ethernet cable with no additional set up necessary.You can then login to the VueZone website and look at your cameras, or view from a cell phone on the app.  I was able to do this very easily.  The cameras do not automatically record.  Since they are wireless, they have batteries that would drain down if they did.  They turn on when you view them, then turn off.  You can also set them to motion record, and either email you the video, or store the video/picture on the vuezone website.One negative is that if you want to use anything more than 2 cameras w/ basic viewing, you need to sign up for a VueZone membership for $5/mo.  Based on how easy this system is to use, and how inexpensive it is, I have no issue paying $5/mo for the service.  But keep that in mind when considering your purchase, as there are other, more expensive systems, that do not require a monthly fee.All in all, this system does exactly what I bought it for, and I am buying extra cameras right now for more coverage.

Reviews.Title: I think for the price and the equipments intented purpose....it is GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Brad Pejsa
Reviews.Content: I have owned the unit for about a month.  If you READ what the unit does and how it is supposed to operate it works as advertised.It took me a few times to get them to sync, but I have not had an issue since.You do have to pay extra for the mobile service....but I noted this as the  beginning so I was not surprised.I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Not bad at all for what it is
Reviews.Author: Shari D.
Reviews.Content: Entry level basic camera that does the trick for the most part. Not at all fancy and no real bells and whistles but if someone comes in your apartment when you're not there they will get caught on camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Easy Wireless Cameras
Reviews.Author: Scott Brownstein
Reviews.Content: Great wireless system, the batteries last about a couple of months or more depending how the use of them could last more.  Easy to set up about 15 minutes the longest bthing is where to mount them.  The only negative things about this sytem is no motion detection through glass so if your looking to record outside you need to buy the outside mount.  The other thing is no night vision abilities.  Otherwise for the price it is a great system.  Look for the Amazon specials deal of the day for your best pricing for a system anywheres from $129.99 to $99.99 its a great deal.

Reviews.Title: an extra set of eyes
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: Love the system, love the design/look!but not so great when one of the cameras is recording...if you have more than one- they all become unavailable for viewing. so if you are expecting a package or someone at the door & the camera alerts you of motion; you will not be able to see who or what triggered the alert. you have to wait until the camera finishes recording the incident and THEN you can view whats happened. so if your child, aging parent, or special needs family member needed you you may as well head in that direction. other than that the system is great to have after the fact.we bought several cameras and didn't realize one wasn't recording any motion, and the other the batteries didn't last a day. was rather disappointing as we were headed out of town that evening. plus- although the company is good in responding to your emails, that is pretty much the only way you reach them...by email.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic System
Reviews.Author: BiologyProfessor
Reviews.Content: I have been buying internet camera systems for years beginning with firewire cameras hooked up to computers to baby monitors to the VueZone system.  This system is incredible, particularly for the price.The system is great because:1) It just works.  People say this about Apple products all of the time, but it is absolutely true of the system.  10-20 minutes of setup, and I had great cameras.2) The batteries last forever.  I have used these for almost six months and the battery levels are not even down one bar.  This is phenomenal for a wireless system.  I was afraid that the batteries would die all of the time; they don't.3) The picture quality is amazing for the size of the camera.4) The clever magnetic attachment system makes these work anywhere.  I have a few fixed places, but I attached one to a GorillaPod, and I can do anything with these small, lightweight cameras.  I have even hung them upside down and the magnets are much stronger than gravity.5) They have never crashed or been unavailable.  I have had zero down time in nearly six months.In short, they are excellent. I will note that I have never used the motion detection feature (except as a quick test the day I bought the system), so I cannot speak to its effectiveness or its effect on battery life.If you need a system for keeping an eye on things or to see in a blind entry way or watching a sleeping child while doing yard work, this is an excellent system.  I am sure that it would work as a pet or nanny cam too.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Smith Family
Reviews.Content: The VueZone cameras install in minutes, and they have a patented peel and stick magnetic mounts let you place your cameras anywhere. Ours is working great; the picture is clear and focused.

Reviews.Title: VueZone system works great! Affordable!
Reviews.Author: Jetson
Reviews.Content: It's nice to have 40 sec clips sent to my email from VueZone's remote server when motion activates my camera! So even if my house burns down or the burglar finds the small camera, I'll still have the burglar on video that I can get from any computer or my smart phone! Way better than the VCR alarm system I used before! Thank you VueZone!

Reviews.Title: Overall a good system
Reviews.Author: Serendipity
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the system and overall it is working well. It doesn't provide the highest quality image or great detail but I use it just to check in and see that all is well at home with our son. It was not intended to be a security system so it does it's job for me.Pros:- Installation is easy- Reliable system- Zoom function is useful- Small cameras with no wires makes for easy setup and relocation- Works well on smartphonesCons:- Low light performance so won't work well in rooms that aren't well lit- Cameras have no wired power option and battery life is short- Fixed 60 degree field of view on the cameras is rather limiting- Monthly service fee if you want to record imaging

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product
Reviews.Author: silverado12775
Reviews.Content: This system was amazing right out of the box,I signed up to the myvue website and set up an account free,plugged in the unit ,matched the camera and I had a security system I could watch my home from my job. It worked so well I ordered a second camera. Well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: doesn't like *other* wireless routers
Reviews.Author: James G. Owen "cranky_programmer"
Reviews.Content: Wed 12/28/2011 5:13 pm. I've spent about an hour trying to get this connected, and eventually the gateway and the camera appeared on my VueZone "settings" tab. The "Cameras" tab produced no picture, but an error message: "This camera is not responding. Please try ... moving the gateway away from other wireless devices like cordless phones and wireless routers". ... Oops! It's *connected* through their supplied ethernet cable to my FIOS wireless router! I hope you don't have one of those; and, gee, I don't see any warnings on the box. I read some of the reviews before purchase. Didn't see any warnings; and actually now I see that at least one reviewer apparently *did* use it with a wireless router; or at least claims it's "easy". Hmmm. ... Well maybe I'll try using a longer ethernet cable. Or maybe I'll return it....

Reviews.Title: Not ready for prime time
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I do not disagree with the main selling points -- no wires and fairly easy setup.  However this product, while useful, is really not a satisfactory security solution.If you read the fine print, you will find that when the camera detects motion, it then still has to warm up for a minute before it starts recording.  That means that whoever triggered the motion detector may already have passed out of range of the camera.Even worse, it seems that there is a glitch in the activation of multiple cameras in succession.  I left three cameras in motion detection mode when I went on a recent vacation.  Before leaving, I checked that each one did indeed activate and record when I walked in front of it.  When I got home again, I decided to test the system by leaving it on as I entered the house.  I walked in front of all three cameras as I came in and put things away.  But only one camera activated and recorded.A minor note:  my experience with setup was not quite as smooth as most report.  I was using an old ethernet hub to split the one port on my base station, and it turned out that the hub was not fast enough to support the Vuezone equipment.  Customer service was no help; I had to figure out for myself what the problem was.  Once I bought a new base station with multiple ethernet ports, setup was straightforward.

Reviews.Title: Teeny Tiny System!!!
Reviews.Author: PattyLouise "Patty"
Reviews.Content: I just received this yesterday and could not wait to set it up...I have always wanted an in home wireless camera system like this and I jumped at the chance to review it.  It could not be more fun...I set it up all by myself...it was clear and easy...just register it, follow the simple quick instructions and you have your own in home secret spy system.  I love it!!!The system itself is so subdued and tiny...it is not really visible or obtrusive at all. My box contained two cameras but my husband already wants more...it is so easy to view what is going on in your house while you are away.  One of the reasons I wanted it was to see what my Tonkinese cat does when we are not there.  I can easily check in from my phone even when we are out for the evening.  This to us is an amazing aspect of this...I can also tell you that we will be purchasing more cameras.  It is so worthwhile.  Again...the cameras are easily moved, very tiny and almost cute.  I think I was expecting something that I would have to hide but this is just not the case.  No one will even notice these.  Instead of a nanny cam we now have a kitty cam!!!An awesome system!!!I am adding a few more thoughts after seeing the way it works while we were away...we loved checking on our house while away...we set the cameras to motion and were able to see a "library" of what was going on...actually not going on...while we were away...thank goodness.We definitely want to buy two or three more cameras to set up in other key rooms even though we have an excellent homesecurity system.

Reviews.Title: Neat concept, POORLY executed, and technical issues...
Reviews.Author: Gary "GB"
Reviews.Content: **************Update 1:This product is actually horrible.  I hooked the unit up again today after not using it for some time.There is a firmware update for the "server" [aka access point or route/gateway], and it will not apply.There is a firmware update for the extra camera will not apply.The unit continues to think I'm viewing another camera, so it will not do anything else.Rebooting the access point does not solve the issue.This product is a farce... if you expect to get decent service, don't.  The reality is that even though this system is 1/2 the price of others, it's more than two times worth of aggrevation.  It doesn't work, AND it wastes your time.  It's not a cost effective product.*************I'm an IT professional... and I specialize in Computer and Network security.  The only reason to say this at all relates to the amount of TRUST you have to place into VueZone, and the reasons I'm not sure this product deserves it.Pros:1) It's a neat concept.2) The equipment is very small.3) The product is, supposed to be, plug and play.Cons:1) The product requires online activation2) The "Premium" server stores content in "the cloud," and there is no guarantee expressed indicating absolute privacy or telling you who's cloud?3) You are given a gateway router for the cameras that plugs into your network, and it can be logged onto.*4) * VueZone doesn't tell you how to logon to YOUR gateway appliance... only the website; they seem to be going out of their way to prevent you using the system locally.5) The VueZone servers tend to drop connections easily, and there are issues with IE 9 and Firefox 11.0 with updating the firmware on the cameras6) If you get the camera system up and running (it appears that you have to contact them to register them system some times), the system takes a considerable amount of time to post your recordings to your "Libray." This is especially true of larger recording that approach your account limit.7) You can only watch one camera at a time, and you can not watch ANY of the cameras if one of them is taking time lasped photos.  (The minimum time for time lapse of one camera is 1 minute.)8) 6 hours of high resolution time lapse photos take up 60MB, and then about 1 hour to be able to view it online.  So far, I've been unable to get the download to work.  This could be related to using a newer secure browser...My experience:I purchased this some time ago directly from the company. When I finally took it out of the box to install it, I noticed that not only did it take awhile to get the unit, but that it had been previously opened.  (Was I sent a unit that was returned?)I then went ahead an attempted to register the unit.  Two times it failed to do so, indicating that I had to call customer service.  So much for a smooth and easy to use product... I then logged into my account (which I had to create in order to purchase the product), and associated the Gateway device with my account. Interestingly, when you logon to the vendor's website (which appears to be the ONLY way to configure your equipment) you are immediately told that your camera's require a firmware update.  Which fails EVERY TIME at 7%... [It may be browser security related, but I don't think you want to "trust" vuezone.com, as Trend A/V reports one of the URL links on the VueZone page as "Dangerous." This means they are hot linking to another website in some manner.]There are reports of the VueZone servers being flaky... and I'm inclined to believe them.  Otherwise, if that's not the problem, than the product itself is flaky OR they're product activation is flaky.  Also, there is a limited market for people that want a product the can't be used as a stand alone device only.Now, if you use any sort of industrial firewall, it's going to be blocking all attempts at speaking to the outside world.  This means that you have to open a vast array of network ports for the device to speak to the internet / VueZone. A list is given by the vendor, but that's about the only technical information you can easily find!I'm just not sure this is a solid product based on what I'm experiencing.

Reviews.Title: As expected
Reviews.Author: Northern light
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and read many reviews before  ordering it. I can say I got what I expected or better.
