Strongly recommend you read reviews so you know what to expect.Delivery was much faster than expected. Was to arrive between Nov 12th and 16th and it arrived on the 6th.Very quick and easy to set up. Ten minutes and you don't need to be techy. It really couldn't be easier.The picture/video quality is ok. It's not high definition but it is more than adequate for my needs. Can clearly recognize faces. More fps would be good and hopefully will come in the future.My camera is outside the door to my condo unit (interior not exterior) so I am able to see who is at the door without going to the door. I also have it set up for motion detected video.The motion detection needed to be adjusted to get it right for the location. I lowered the sensitivity level to 10. The field of "sensitivity" is wider than the field of "view" so at the higher sensitivity levels it would record when people walked by the door but out of view. Now it only triggers recordings when they are in the field of view.I have it set to send me an email when there is motion detected. The email comes quickly and the whole recording can be watched by tapping the image on my iPhoneThe iPhone app is more limited than the computer website for options but does what I need it to.The website functions are simple easy and intuitive.The camera base has a hole to hang it from a hook or you can peel off the paper and stick it to the wall/door. The camera then attaches to it with a magnet. The camera can be then directed in unlimited ways.I gave it 4 stars because I think it's a bit pricey and the fps are low for the price but as I said I got what I expected and it's doing what I need it to, so I am pleased.

Reviews.Title: This is a great system and is easy to set up!
Reviews.Author: Renata Circeo
Reviews.Content: I have lake vacation property and wanted to keep an eye on the outside areas for security purposes.  I set it up in less than 10 minutes.  The cameras come with magnified bases which install in less than a minute and you can move them around or take them off the base by just pulling or pushing the camera.  I am thinking about getting a couple more sets for my beach homes and signing up for the $9.99 per month option!

Reviews.Title: Easy and Good for monitoring...
Reviews.Author: homerj
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed at how the NETGEAR Vuezone was fast and easy to get up and running both on my home network and my iPhone. The directions were simple and easy to follow and I had two cameras up and running in 20 minutes. The system captures still images and video very well with ambient indoor or outdoor light and just OK when there is motion or at night. Its designed to monitor and check in on what's going on at home... not as a security survailence system. Its great for checking in on kids, pets or visitors to your home. If you want to record or use for security purposes, this is not the set-up for you. In the weeks I've been using this system I have had some minor connection issues where the camera link is dropped but it has always resolved itself with a "refresh". Its great to have access from either my laptop of my iPhone whenever and wherever I want. I received these cameras from NETGEAR for free to evaluate but the listed price does seem reasonable for the right situation. I would recommend this product to anyone with kids or pets that wants to keep an eye on their home.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: amazonbob
Reviews.Content: Summary:NOT GOOD FOR:1) seeing the license plate of a car2) seeing anyone's faceGOOD FOR:1) Watching a small driveway for cars2) Seeing that someone is at your doorDetails:I purchased this not from amazon but from local store. The device is nice and relatively easy to set up, however, the image quality is awful. The free snapshot email service hardly captures a person let alone recognizable facial features with normal motion in front of the camera. You either must be immediately in front of the camera for any decent image to be captured of a person's face, or you have to stand essentially completely still. I don't know why other people have purchased the camera device, but I had purchased it to keep an eye on my apartment when I wasn't there and to be able to respond to anyone who thought it a good idea to come into my apartment. However, this is not good enough for that function. It might be okay for monitoring bulk changes, like a car pulling into a driveway, and that a figure has walked to your door, but definitely NOT GOOD ENOUGH FOR FACIAL RECOGNITION. If I think of it, I will amend this posting to let those who care know what I found suitable. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: VueZone System
Reviews.Author: Consume M
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install and works very well.  I will probably buy more in the future and already recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: Good unit for first time users
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Adamson
Reviews.Content: This is an easy unit to setup and provides excellent video quality.  I think the units can be improved it they provided a camera that could swivel using remote access.

Reviews.Title: Good for home monitoring/security
Reviews.Author: Jaime "Out to tackle the best sci-fi ... duri...
Reviews.Content: I live in a condo where the management has keys to every unit. I have extra piece of mind knowing that nobody can enter my apartment without me knowing. Installation is easy and the battery life of the cameras are great. It is important to mention that the cameras don't always record... only when motion is detected or when you instruct it to. I recommend getting the smart phone app since flash is required for the website viewer.

Reviews.Title: Lets me keep an eye on the dog
Reviews.Author: Aramat "Aramat"
Reviews.Content: Very stable connection.  I can view the dog while I'm at work.  I wish the camera was wide angle though.  I'm on the 2nd year of use, and I've only had to replace one of the batteries.  I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Starts off as advertised, but gets spotty in 6 months
Reviews.Author: Webbed Feet
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because I wanted to keep an eye on my home during the day. The camera is advertised as easy to set up and use. No problems there. It also comes with a pretty nice mounting system that let's you hang it off of nearly any surface. The still picture quality is decent but does not capture fast-moving subjects well. The video is similar in quality to what a 5 year old mobile phone camera would be able to capture. There is a low light setting that must be turned on by the user on Vuezone's web page. Unlike IR enabled cameras, this camera does not capture low light pictures well on its own. If you are using this camera as a motion detector, you will receive email photos only unless you purchase one of the manufacturer's premium plans. I have contacted the manufacturer once to ask for a replacement battery cover after the camera accidentally fell onto the floor. Customer service was great! They sent a replacement at no charge.In part, I purchased this camera as a back up to another ip camera (connected wirelessly to my lan). I thought that since this camera's gateway device is actually connected to my modem, it would be a rock solid device. Unfortunately for the past several weeks this has not been true. The gateway seems to lose internet connectivity on a routine basis - every 3 days or so. Every time the connection is lost, I reboot the gateway and that seems to solve the connectivity problem for the next several days until the problem resurfaces.I need to contact customer service to get some trouble-shooting help. However, as a motion detector it has lost my confidence and I will be getting another camera to replace this one.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: J. B. Spilger
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 1 motion/ 1 Indoor model for my small business. I will soon purchase additional cameras. Although the camera view is not wide angle, the picture is good & the set up is easy.  Maybe 5 min The controls are easy, both on the web & via my iPhone. E-mails for motion detection are great, but you might want to turn off this feature when you are moving around the camera.I haven't tried the weather proof housing for an outdoor camera, but I will be soon.I'll be getting one of these systems for my houseNote: If you have a large area to cover, get multiple cameras as they don not cover a wide area.

Reviews.Title: DOES NOT WORK ON ANDROID 4.0
Reviews.Author: James Costantini
Reviews.Content: One of the main reasons I got this was because I wanted to use it on my Galaxy Nexus Android phone. Unfortunately, the app does not work with Android 4.0. Now, the only way to access mobile is via web browser, and that doesn't work well either. Waste of money unless they stay true to their advertising and update their software....

Reviews.Title: I couldn't be much better!
Reviews.Author: BJF
Reviews.Content: This is one of those rare items that works perfectly and is simple to set-up. This combined with flawless Amazon service... and I am using it in my vacation house a continent away!

Reviews.Title: Vue Zone
Reviews.Author: Dylan "Boca Raton"
Reviews.Content: It is a good camera system, easy to install and to configure it with your router. The quality is werethe system is not so great and to access it on line, it takes too long to switch from one camera to the other ,nothing terrible, but could be better, specially with 4G LTE connection that I have. Overall the system is OKfor the low price you pay for it. I am happy with mine, since we are using it at home mostly to monitor our dog.It's worth the money we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Video is just OK - Super Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: GatorMan
Reviews.Content: Got this system so we could check on our house when out of town...or see what the dogs were up to.  Hey its pretty nice - but the video quality isn't the best....but system was super easy to setup.  And I need to explore the capabilities better on the infared motion options.  Not a bad deal for the price.  If video was a tad better it would get 5 stars...works good to the iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Neat Tool for Home Security!
Reviews.Author: Daniel L. Parrott "parrotthead09"
Reviews.Content: This VueZone Remote Wireless camera was easy to set up and use.  All you need is an empty port on your router, plug it in and you're set.  Get your software loaded and set up (for both your desktop and mobile device), and you'll get email notices whenever the motion sensor is activated, along with a link to see a 10 second clip (default) of video.  In addition, the provided webspace stores past video clips at no extra charge.  I think that you can add up to 15 cameras to each "Gateways".  Neat!

Reviews.Title: Functional and efficient
Reviews.Author: John M. Stafiej "John"
Reviews.Content: Vue Camera is so simple to set up and to use. Love the iPhone app feature. This little gadget works like a charm.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for a small business
Reviews.Author: Flower Power
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Vuzone System I with the indoor and motion camera. I was so excited to get it because I have a small business and want to ensure my safety given the high level of crime these days. Upon arrival, I was very pleased to see it was a simple set of equipment. Like most, I did not have any problems with the installation. I greatly recommend this product. Some have stated that the picture was grainy and I have to disagree. Mine is crystal clear to the point I can almost see the work on my staffs desk. I surely give it 5 stars!!! As a matter of fact, I even ordered two more indoor cameras to add on!!

Reviews.Title: easiest setup ever
Reviews.Author: Chris's mom
Reviews.Content: So, I just got this from Amazon and I had fun hooking it up!  No special adjustments to my router or anything, just plugged it in and followed the directions.  OMG!!!  It took longer to get the batteries put in than to set up the system.  I am SO surprised!  The picture quality is okay for low light (it's late at night here), the cameras are small and easy to position.  I can't wait to see how they do over the next few weeks.  I also ordered extra batteries since they don't take AA or AAA's.  I have tried other internet cameras but the instructions were just too much for me and I could never figure it out.....there are just 6 steps for this, from plug in to view online.  I'm hoping this security system will help me to watch my place when I am not there....I also ordered a regular add-on camera so I have two cameras on my system.  At this point, I would say buy it if you are looking for an easy home security camera system.

Reviews.Title: Vuezone camera
Reviews.Author: Alfred C. Chovanetz
Reviews.Content: Great system. Connection could stay more reliable. Keeps dropping. Infrared option would be great.  An outdoor weatherproof box would be good also.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money
Reviews.Author: Danielle A. Dilisio
Reviews.Content: I love this system! I personally use it to keep an eye on my pets when I am travelling, but it would also work well for kids. Very easy set up. You will need a router which will run you about $40-$50 or more depending upon how fancy you want to get. I like the fact that one gateway will manage up to (25) cameras. The cameras do not have a very wide angle, but all you have to do is place them high to get a larger viewing range. I look forward to using and expanding this system for many years!

Reviews.Title: Vuezone is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Must have system, works like a charm. Easy to set up and maintain. The motion sensor picks up at 15 - 20 feet, and shoots an email to your mobile phone or PC with a 10-40 sec video. I would recommend this device to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great System
Reviews.Author: sa225
Reviews.Content: The cameras work great, they are exactly what i expected. I didn't need a system that records. Really just wanted something i could use to check in on once in a while. They do exactly that. Video is a little choppy but thats what I expected. The best part of the system is the app for both the droid and iphone. Very easy set-up and convenient to view from the phones. Only negative is that I'm often unable to view my cameras from the web page.

Reviews.Title: So Far; So Good
Reviews.Author: Ann in Dallas
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased a two-camera system for family members to keep an eye on an aging parent with dementia. Pleased with the results so far especially for the $$$ spent.Pros- Super-easy set up.- Thoughtful design.- Everything in kit even extra mounts.- Well-written instructions.- Good color saturation.- Acceptable resolution/frame-rates.- Good light sensitivity even in Normal mode.- Seamless integration with web portal.- Reasonable number of recording options.- Good battery performance.- Awesome iPhone mobile app.- Responsive and technically proficient tech support.Cons- Web site a little slow.- Some software hiccups on same.- Would like more recording options, such as allowing permanent access to video library rather than invite-only on a per-video basis.- No Windows Phone mobile app available.Caveats1. The system operates on the unregulated 2.4 GHz ISM band, which is the same segment used by Wi-Fi (802.11 b, g, n), some cordless phones, and microwave ovens. VueZone incorporates frequency-hopping technology (FHSS) to minimize interference but if you have a wireless router you will want to set the base station as far away as possible or contact tech support to set your router on a different frequency.2. The documentation does not clearly tell you which features are available for the Admin account vs Friend accounts. For example, Full-Screen mode,  which looks great BTW, is only available for the Admin.ConclusionsNot a perfect system, but cannot be beat for the money.Did I mention the system looks great? It does. It's a well-thought-out package down to the details of its optional components. From a hardware perspective it's a solid marriage of function and design.Hopefully the company will address some of the web-based software glitches and add features to the video recording and library functions. Aside from that this product is a winner.Update: 10-27-2012--------------------It's been six months.  Have maxed-out the system with five cameras.  Still happy with the purchase.  Just wish the system were a little more reliable.Occasionally someone needs to be present to reboot the base station, router, or both.  If you are thinking of using this at a vacant property, you should consider other systems.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: A. Urtis "A U"
Reviews.Content: It's really working as describe. It gives you the peace of mind knowing to see what's going on with just a click of your finger.

Reviews.Title: Good Idea, disappointing results
Reviews.Author: weekendrunner
Reviews.Content: Very excited to order this product.  Unfortunately very disappointed with the results.  The cameras did not work when more than a few feet from the base hub (ours were about 10 feet away), and whenever we left it on in the day did not turn on with the motion detector.  Would have to come back and resync to start again.Much of the value add services (such as motion detector emailing etc) you have to pay for on a monthly basis, so I would expect it to work every time.Ultimately i think it was an issue with the range of the satallite cameras from the base so we just sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Additional Plan needed
Reviews.Author: Rage
Reviews.Content: This review in no way reflects the purchasing and shipping from Amazon I'm 100% satisfied with that.After purchasing the item I found out that in order to view your cameras on a mobile device you would need to sign up for an additional plan of $40 a year and a premier account to use the mobile device feature. Yes that account offers additional features but for me just being able to check your camera while being on a mobile device should be included in the basic plan

Reviews.Title: Used it first day, never turned it on again
Reviews.Author: Rob R.
Reviews.Content: This product requires you to use the manufacturers website and you cannot use it without them.  They restrict much of the functionality of the product unless you pay a monthly fee.  The camera is small and runs on batteries... which is great.  But being tied to their website make it not usable at all.

Reviews.Title: Misleading Advertising
Reviews.Author: ZombieJunkie
Reviews.Content: Stay away!  Do not purchase!  Shame on you Amazon!I am very disappointed with this product and its misleading advertising.  This is borderline false advertising!  I saw no mention in the product description that I would need to "subscribe" to a $38/yr service to view images on my mobile device.  Had I read the right customer reviews, I would have seen other customers complaining about this issue.Amazon needs to add the following in the product description:  "Requires monthly service fee to access via smarthphones."

Reviews.Title: Dead on arrival
Reviews.Author: S. Henry
Reviews.Content: Setup was easy; the gateway connected to the website properly, and the camera synced with the gateway... but after an hour of fiddling with settings, browsers, and restarts, I was unable to make the system display even a single image.  Add to that the fact that (a) the "gold box" price was only $10 less than the price currently offered by the manufacturer, and (b) the basic (free) plan no longer offers smartphone viewing, and the result is that this thing is being returned tomorrow.The recent subscription changes and heavy manufacturer discounts make me suspect that Vuezone isn't doing too well... and if they disappear, this item will become utterly useless.======Update: The day after I posted the above review, Vuezone attempted to contact me by phone and email in order to try to resolve the issues I had.  Kudos to them for their proactive customer support... I'm sure that eventually we would have gotten it to work, if I hadn't already sent it back to Amazon.Their initial diagnosis (based on their own server logs) was that a firmware update was required... or in other words, the hardware was shipped in a non-functional state and needed "fixing".  I had been notified during the setup process that an update was needed, but the update process also failed repeatedly.Even if the hardware worked, though, I still didn't like the fact that the features of the Basic plan are VERY limited, contrary to the product description.  I'd also be concerned about the privacy aspect of having my pictures automatically uploaded to an external web server.  Come to think of it, since the camera is controlled entirely through the Vuezone website, there's really no telling when you might be on camera, or who might be watching!I wanted to like this product; I like the wireless, on-demand feature, and the magnetic mount system is ingenious.  Other reviews here suggest that it may be possible to access the gateway directly and bypass the Vuezone server/subscription process entirely.  If I had known that to be the case (and if the hardware worked), I might have stuck with it... but there's no documentation of that.

Reviews.Title: Doggy cam
Reviews.Author: sneaky-sneaky
Reviews.Content: For what it is, the product is ok.  I'm not a super tech guy, so I'm not sure about alternatives, viewing by phone, or price point.  You get a year free with the unit, and after that it's like fifty bucks annually. Essentially you are using the VueZone's system, and as others have pointed out, it would become just so much plastic if the company dissappears into the globalized aether.  For a basic nannycam/bad cat cam, the unit is fine.  But if you have a house on the other side of the country or something then the idea of flying out there to reset cameras or change batteries is pretty ridiculous and you would be advised to look into something hardwired.

Reviews.Title: the blur
Reviews.Author: LLT
Reviews.Content: when someone walks thtough the room that person is blurred and unrecognizable. Identification can only be made is the person stops in the field of view.

Reviews.Title: Too pricey for the features.
Reviews.Author: occasional-buyer
Reviews.Content: Good features but to get the most out of, you have to pay a monthly or yearly fee.  I couldn't justify the cost so I returned it.  If they change their pricing model, I might reconsider it in the future.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Puppy Cam!
Reviews.Author: Julia Philyaw-Durand
Reviews.Content: I just received my Netgear VueZone and it is awesome! The color and clarity is incredible. Set up is easier than you can imagine. And thats not all, to view it on my iphone was just as easy. Download the VueZone app for iphone or Android and login using the login information you created during the set-up. We mounted the magnetic ball to hold the camera in the desired location on the wall and viewed the picture from our laptop to help with placement. Now we are ready for the arrival of our Boxer puppies. The grandchildren are also able to login and check on our expectant mom. I only wish I had ordered two cameras for when our dog left her bed for another room in the house. This was worth every penny and the puppies are not even here yet! I have not used motion sensor, I simply keep a live stream so the grandkids can check in anytime.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reviews.Title: Customer Support - Beware - Netgear Took Over
Reviews.Author: Ed F.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product before Netgear bought out the company.  When I heard Netgear purchased them, I knew customer support was going to suffer and I've unfortunately been right about that so far.The Vuezone product itself is easy to use and works for the basic functions I'm looking for, but be aware that Netgear tech support is poor and they haven't yet fully absorbed the Vuezone products into their systems.  Here's an example.  I went online for support this morning and was routed to Netgear's technical support site.  It asked me to enter my product serial number before proceeding with Live Chat, so I entered the Vuezone serial number.  The system wasn't able to find it which meant it wouldn't let me proceed with the support session.I also have other Netgear products (switches, etc...) and although their products are acceptable, the technical support and sales support is very weak.  Netgear hasn't yet learned that offshoring all technical support to people that work from scripts and have a poor command of the English language may be an "inexpensive" way to provide support, but the customer experience suffers greatly as a result.  I would pay a little more for my products if I could get US based customer support with excellent English skills.Want information on their home or small business products?  Try calling their main corporate number and ask to be routed to someone in Sales to get more information.  You'll go right to voice mail.  I tried this several times over the course of a couple of days and it was the same result every time.Netgear could excel much further as a company if they made some critical changes to their technical support and sales support areas.  Until that time, I don't plan on purchasing any of their products.Ed

Reviews.Title: Absolute Crap
Reviews.Author: Garth Brodie
Reviews.Content: After ready most of the the positive reviews, I thought this might be a good product for us.After receiving the product, within 15 days I was totaling pissed off!  The system did not work well at all, would not update the firmware of the cameras, would not connect with the app most of the time, website never worked, always broken.Then came the best part of all, 30 Day money back guarantee !!!!  What an absolute joke. If they could find a better way to spin you around, push you off and generally harass you to the point you feel it is not worth it - I don't think they could. The web site has 30 day money back guarantee phone number, the help line says you can do it online, except the online website is broken, totally messed. Finally got to the spot were they say to select the order and hit the "request for return / money back" - NO BUTTON EXISTS!!!! So back on the phone I have to go for another few hours of on hold and being pushed around.END POINTDO NOT BUY THIS CRAP PRODUCT WITH CRAP SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Our Family use of Vuezone Video.
Reviews.Author: Richard Keller
Reviews.Content: This review is about how our family uses the Vuezone system rather than a review of the hardware. Previous reviews describe the excellent performance of the system, its ease of setup.  I particularly enjoy seamless setup of multiple installations.  I have three gateways running in three locations across the country and they are all visible on the Vuezone secure website.More to come on how we use the system.

Reviews.Title: Unique idea but execution not so much....
Reviews.Author: Hassan "hraza76"
Reviews.Content: For the first few days, it was working great. I decided to turn on the motion detection which is where the problem started for me.  When recorded after motion detection the  recorded video adds artificial darkness.  What I mean is the recording in broad day light would appear as if its being taken in very low light conditions.  This renders the recorded video useless as one can barely see anything. I called their customer support and was told that the second tier support team will have to trouble shoot and they will call me in few days.  Pathetic service so far as they should be able to handle this right away, especially since I bought the premier service.  I will update this review once I hear back from them.UPDATE:  Was called back the same day by Tier two team.  After running through some initial diagnosis, the rep decided to send a new camera.  Camera was shipped with expedited shipping.  So far, happy with the customer service and will update the rating accordingly.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: xmasboy "xmasboy"
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably easy to set up. Seems to do as promised. I've not used it whole lot yet. I installed the iphone app, it was easy to use, can view at will, zoom in and zoom out.I'm using with a Mac, which likely adds to the ease of set up.

Reviews.Title: VueZone
Reviews.Author: eckman
Reviews.Content: Have been testing this system for awhile now and it is just ok. Low light quaility is poor and even with the 40watt bulb as the company recommends. Day time quality is just ok, video is not as good as I had hoped it would be. I do not think I would buy it again based on the video quality and slow camera performance. Do yourself a favor and research all types of systems like this that are out there before you spend your money.

Reviews.Title: There are some major limitations
Reviews.Author: RainHopper
Reviews.Content: Depending on your needs, you can give this product anywhere between 3 to 5 stars.Pros:1.  Very easy to set up, even a caveman can do it!  I was up and running in 10 minutes.2.  Its small size makes it easy to place the camera anywhere you want3.  The mounting system is quite ingenious.  Once the half dome mount is attached to the wall either by screw or adhesive, the camera is attached to the mount magnetically.  You can therefore point the camera in a number of directions easily.Cons:1. picture quality is poor.  If you are keeping an eye on your dog(s), it is okay.  If you intend to catch someone who is stealing your mail, the resolution is too poor to get good identification.2. There is no option to have an AC supply for the camera.  The camera can only be powered by two small batteries.3. The ease of installation and the small size of the camera make it easy for someone to remove and carry off.  Once again, if you are just watching your dog(s), that is not an issue.  But if you leave it in a public area, you may find the camera missing along with all other belongings.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The easiest high tech gadget that I have set up.  Incredibly simple to set up.  Excellent product except for the price which I find to be high compared to other similar products.  I purchased it because it  is wireless, inconspicuous and easy to set up.  I am disappointed that the cameras cannot detect motion through thermal/double pane windows.

Reviews.Title: Ok but could be better
Reviews.Author: ROWELLA C. LILES
Reviews.Content: It's really good as far as being totally wireless. However it's a camera that's meant to be checked only a couple minutes during the day as the battery runs out fast. I like that u can view remotely from ur smartphone through the app or from ur browser. No sounds so if u want something that has sound this isn't for you. Also if ur looking for something to record I'm afraid this isn't for you either. The only feature that I really love is the fact that it's wireless however they need to do something about the battery running out in no time. I think it's overpriced for the quality that ur getting, but it did the basic thing I needed to do. Also don't count on the motion sensor. Didnt work for me plus it's gonna eat ur battery.

Reviews.Title: eh
Reviews.Author: GK "GK"
Reviews.Content: quality isn't the greatest.. it stopped working after 5 months (too grainy to see the image) . there are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work
Reviews.Author: Ahmed A. R. Baqer
Reviews.Content: This product didn't work as my ISP firewall prevented me from connecting to the main server of this system overseas.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for dog owner
Reviews.Author: I need to return some video tapes
Reviews.Content: i live in chicago and have a dog walker come to my apartment and let out my dog.  he stays in the living room and i keep my bedroom door closed. no reason for anyone to be there.  i have one camera at the door to see when she arrives and leaves and one in the family area.  it suits it purpose for peace of mind.  when I'm away i like to check the live feed what my dog is doing, usually tearing something expensive up or sleeping.  but it works flawlessly and is great. the batteries you put into the cameras you should buy off amazon also before hand because your hardware store will chafe you your left leg when there actually cheap.  BUY IT!

Reviews.Title: Poor performance, useless design
Reviews.Author: HighTech
Reviews.Content: The cameras lack "Auto-Iris" which means you have to set the exposure daily as the sun comes up, or at nightfall.You can not "mask" areas (such as the street traffic).It eats batteries (a pair of CR123A) like candy at $7 a pair.It quite often loses sync and has to be restarted, does not tell you a camera has died (dead battery) and it falses like crazy.Distance from the base stations is limited, can only record ONE camera per base at a time...so when the camera over your driveway triggers, the other cameras go blind and you can NOT watch them remotely while this is happening. If you set the time to 90 seconds, you will receive a email..but cant watch it! There is NO SUPPORT for this device!! It has evolved to what it is and has reached a dead end. No improvements for the past year.It is subject to interference on the 2.4Ghz band, so if you place it near ANYTHING (like a baby monitor/Wireless LAN/cordless phone/wireless speaker/alarm system) you can bet it will cause you grief.The design is OLD (Jan 8,2011) and has not been updated.It is obsolete, Vuezone/Netgear knows this and has no intention of supporting this product.Cameras have improved a lot over the past 3 years. The people at Vuezone have been friendly, but this is not a "Surveillance" device by any means. It's fine for a "Doggy-Cam" but forget it as a home security device, a waste of money. We now use ours as a toy for our Pembroke Welsh Corgi...we toss or roll the camera and keep the videos from that playtime. Yes it's an expensive "ChewToy" but thats all it's good for.Repeated calls to Netgear/Vuezone has resulted in little assistance, product has never lived up to it's description, nor can it with the current firmware it uses in the cameras and base stations.Please realize this is a "Dead End" product and it is "what it is".I can't rate it lower than 1 star.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Home Security
Reviews.Author: bagmiester
Reviews.Content: I use this all the time when I leave the house. It may not prevent a burglar, but at least I'll have a record of who it was.

Reviews.Title: BEST VALUE FOR YOUR BUCK!
Reviews.Author: Mary Dillard "teachingmy2"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to keep an eye on my boys.  I am upset at myself for not ordering two cameras!  I also have a small business which I plan to purchase an additional set.  Shipper was quick Beachcamera.com! This camera was easy to use simple directions picture quality clear! mounting directions simple I would definitely order more!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: NDN RN
Reviews.Content: Excellent for the price. i am able to monitor my home from anywhere I can use my smart phone. I cam also watch my kids from another part of the house

Reviews.Title: Just ok, recommend looking for newer technology
Reviews.Author: Bjorn199
Reviews.Content: Used it for a couple of years off and on.Pros:  I found it easy to do initial setup.  The ability to use completely wirelessly was main benefit.  If using to occasionally check on a room with no motion, then fine.Cons:  Batteries expensive.  Video framerate was awful and made the system unusable unless there was no motion in the video.  Motion detection was spotty and often had delays.  Apps and website were constantly buggy and not user-friendly.  Subscription charge was the main deterent as cost/benefit was not there.

Reviews.Title: Security
Reviews.Author: Sammy
Reviews.Content: For the price of an inexpensive wireless security system this is a must have.  The picture quality is clear and you have peace of mind to be protected when you are away from home or business.  I would recommend this product to everyone.  Also it is so easy  to setup, it doesn't take a rocket scientist to set up, takes just minutes.

Reviews.Title: can't see anything at night time
Reviews.Author: Willie
Reviews.Content: can't see anything at night time, it did not come with the wall attachment kit (missing from the box), I has a lag (delay) time with poor quality playback.

Reviews.Title: Video with limitations
Reviews.Author: M. Bohle "Elusive Dog"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two cameras on a lightning deal, one takes snapshots on demand and the other works based on motion detection.  The snap shot demand camera is useless in my view.  The motion detection camera is far more useful (you can adjust the sensitivity).  The daytime images are good, night photos are poor.  Installation was very easy, battery life on the cameras has been great. If you are looking for an inexpensive snap shot camera set-up this product might work for you.  If you want to record images you will need to upgrade from the free basic plan to a monthly pay plan (options not clear until you visit the website).  You get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly for Pet watching!
Reviews.Author: Randy Lee
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, cameras are not great, but not bad! Wish they had sound!!!! Easy to expand to as many cameras as you need.

Reviews.Title: Recent subscription policy change makes it not worth it
Reviews.Author: Broken Penguin "Roger"
Reviews.Content: VueZone recently started requiring paid subscription for viewing from smartphone, iPad, etc. If you even want to charge people for basic streaming (not for taking and storing pictures/videos), you have crossed the line. When I bought mine, VueZone did not specify that subscription fee is required to use it and I would not have bought the cameras if that was the case. This will be bad start for VueZone and they should learn from Netflix.Update 12/23/2011:VueZone confirmed that customers with previously owned systems will be able to continue using VueZone Mobile until the end of 2012. I have updated my rating to reflect their responsiveness and the fact that I am overall very satisfied with the product itself.

Reviews.Title: Battery nightmare
Reviews.Author: alan6840
Reviews.Content: I bought this system with a total of 9 cameras and placed them around my house. Some worked, some never did, and batteries were good for a couple of hours but that was it. They sent me replacement batteries at no charge but to no avail, they too stopped working shortly thereafter. This is a waste of time and money. I don't think wireless works very well and is totally unreliable. If you want a camera system then buy a professionally installed setup.

Reviews.Title: Might Work If Not Planning To Use VueZone Website
Reviews.Author: edward VI
Reviews.Content: Spent hours on IP camera reviews.  Found the best advice was one given by a reviewer who had wasted many hours trying to make one work. He said if you cannot get it to work within an hour, don't waste your time like he did.  It's either going to work in your particular situation or not.There are many reasons for this.  You can find them in other reviews. Many are simple, like some software not accepting certain character or spaces, others are technically complex.Having said that, I found this camera to be very easy to install and connect to my internet modem/router (about 2 minutes). If you are tech savvy and do not plan to use the VueZone website service, it might just work for you, otherwise, read on.I have a very simple situation: phone company modem/router, no network. It does not get simpler than that. The problem I ran into was the VueZone website, to which you have to connect to view your images via internet. This website is a nightmare.  False errors, false navigation, freezing up, etc.  This is all before I even got to register the camera to it!  When it finally registered it, it was telling me that I had a bad connection, even though the lights on the camera were telling me it was properly connected.  I tried everything I could think of for over an hour then decided to follow that wise reviewer's advice and returned it. Hard to believe their "user" website is so bad when their "marketing" website is so impressive.I should note that I also bought an Astak Mole IP camera, also from Amazon, and that connected and got registered on the suggested Yoics website beautifully in 10 minutes and has been working fine since.  So I guess that wise reviewer was absolutely right: it will work right away for you...or not!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: James S Young
Reviews.Content: Install took 10 min. Loaded the app on every smart device in the household. Motion Sensor on the front door camera documents every visitor to the house. We have 4 cameras now and We keep track of what our 2 kids are up to when we are out. Great new product!

Reviews.Title: It works well and is easy to set up and use
Reviews.Author: D. Means
Reviews.Content: Overall I was pretty impressed with the VueZone Personal Video Network. As advertised, it was very simple to set this up and get it working; amazingly easy! You should know in advance that to use this system you must first have an internet ready computer and a router to connect to. VueZone has a detailed privacy policy and so take steps to ensure that your images and videos are stored securely; so only you can access them on their server. You will get 2GB of storage space when you register your product; plenty of storage for most people's needs. From there you can maintain your personal library of videos and images.Once you get your cameras positioned where you want them it is very easy to see what the camera is transmitting but logging on to their website and choosing the camera of interest. You can only see the output of one camera at a time but switching between them is quite easy. First, you pause the currently selected camera, then click onthe image of the one you want to change to.Taking pictures and videos is extremely easy and is done using the interface that their website provides. They all get stored using the 2GB of space you are allowed on their server. Accessing them is also done on their website and is generally pretty quick and easy. From there you can download to your computer, upload to a site like YouTube, or share videos and images via email. Sharing with email will give recipient the ability to view selected videos or pictures on the vuezone site.You can choose from 2 image resolutions. The first choice is 320x240 which is smaller but allows for a faster frame rate resulting in smoother video playback. The second is 640x480 along with a slower framerate and so the video looks more jerky/stop-motion.Downloading pictures taken using the 640x480 resolution gives pictures that are appx 15kb in size.Pictures taken using the 320x240 resolution picture size is around 5KB.Pictures and videos can be shared (via email or uploaded to a website like youtube) or downloaded as a zip file.30 sec video size: .6MB20 sec video size: .4MB10 sec video at 320x240 resolution size: .1MBThe camera's image can be seen in it's actual size or in full screen mode. As you would expect, the resolution is a bit grainy in full screen but is still quite viewable and acceptable. There is a setting that can be made for each camera that allows you to choose the brightness level. This is very helpful since it allows for bright or very low light applications.Note that no sound is recorded. The cameras do not have a microphone.You can get their Premier Service for an additional charge of $49.95/year. To learn more check out this link:[...]The cameras have a wireless range of up to 300 ft. line of sight  from the gateway. In indoor installations, the range will decrease and be dependent on environmental factors such as metal obstructions, wall and ceiling thickness, and other such obstructions. In general, your VueZone wireless network will have a wireless transmission range similar to an 802.11 wireless device. I found that I could place the cameras anywhere in my house or even front/back yard and they worked just fine.The motion detection can be enabled or disabled. When enabled, the camera records 10 seconds worth of video each time the sensor is triggered. These videos are all stored on the VueZone cloud server; along with all your other pictures and videos. What I found is that if you have 2 (or presumably more) cameras both set for motion detection, that only one can record at a time. As a test, I set them both pointing to the same location, both enabled for motion detection. When I walked into the motion range detection area both cameras sensed my presence. Ten seconds of video was stored for each camera. But, it was not the same ten seconds. The second camera switched on to record when the first one finished; so I got a total of twenty seconds of video.This is a very nice and easy to setup and use system. It is not perfect and I'm sure that improvements will be forthcoming. A couple of changes I would hope for are to be able to plug in the cameras instead of relying on batteries. Also, I would like to have the ability to use the system locally instead of having to rely on their website to view and control the cameras. For now, it is well worth the price and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Vuezone July 2011 Update
Reviews.Author: heybob
Reviews.Content: I first saw Vuezone monitoring system on a relative's iPhone and was fascinated that he could instantly view their lake house thousands of miles away.We have two homes which are subject to bad weather and occasional curious critters prowling about.  I immediately ordered two systems and have added additional cameras and now view the homes several times a day, and have the motion detectors email me whenever there is activity within camera range.  The system installs easily and their web site works flawlessly.Here's what I like:Installation: Plug-in simple.  The wireless control plugs into my wireless router and the battery operated cameras can be placed inside anywhere.  In shopping for other wireless monitoring systems it was difficult to tell how they are configured and what "wireless" meant;is there a controller; is it Wi-Fi, etc. These sytems required coordinating my web address among other unpredictable tasks.  Vuezone is very clear and requires no network customization to install.  Choices of services require a click of my mouse.Operation: I view remotely from my PC and my wife's iPad.  My Palm Pre phone doesn't monitor, but is able to view clips if there is an intrusion, all of which is fine with me.  Their web site is clear and has an effective set of controls to optimize the quality of the video, and control what you want to monitor and not.  I like the ability to adjust the sensitivity of the camera so a falling leaf doesn't result in a false motion alarm.Economy: The sytems are fairly priced.  I would expect to subscibe to their plan that supports multiple systems, but that has not been implemented.Here's what would earn that last star:Offer a camera that can be placed outdoors. Also, complete offering the plans they say are available in their ads, like supporting multiple installations on one site and bill. I love the idea they can feed sensors off their wireless controller.  How about adding a temperature sensor to make sure the house stays above freezing?Summary: In protecting our homes through video monitoring this is a valuable product and relaible service that is well designed and executed.  There may be other sytems that offer sound, the ability to pan and dynamically zoom, but they are exponentially more complex to operate in my opinion.  Vuezone puts this all together in a neat, simple package.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE NOT NEW, REFURBISHED & MISSING CR123A PHOTO BATTERIES
Reviews.Author: DIXONVAG "faction718"
Reviews.Content: VueZone System with 1 Indoor Motion Detection Camera (SM2200) was obviously refurbished and MISSING THE REQUIRED AND NOTED TO BE INCLUDED SPECIAL PHOTO CR123A BATTERIES.LAME.

Reviews.Title: Love this system!
Reviews.Author: oshomar
Reviews.Content: Waiting to get some funds to buy another camera. I should have bought 2 cameras initially. Camera can be moved around where I want it to be. I don't mind paying a yearly subscription because it's cheaper than most home security systems

Reviews.Title: Great home security
Reviews.Author: TJ CRAYNE
Reviews.Content: Although I had some difficulty with placement of cameras (due to distance from the hub), once setup the system is working flawlessly.  Easy to setup, using motion detection cameras with alerts in outside areas, the system helps with peace of mind!  Works great.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't have an App for my HTC Phone!
Reviews.Author: C. Robinson
Reviews.Content: This is nice if you have access to a computer that can stream video all the time, but I cannot access the video at work (it is blocked), so I when I upgraded my mobile phone I was excited to download the app to my new phone, but they don't have the app to use with a HTC EVO (Android) phone!  I was disappointed because Android phones are so popular, so I feel like I wasted my money.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use and setup but realize it is a basic system
Reviews.Author: Bill Bierbower
Reviews.Content: I was suspicious kids were getting into my booze cabinet and wanted to monitor my attic for squirrels coming in.  Got it and was done with setup in 15 minutes.  I was able to confirm my suspicion by placing a camera in my liquor cabinet.  The no wires, self powered make install a snap, anywhere.  The interface is easy to use and the iPhone app is pretty good.  I just ordered a second one for a rental home we have that I'm suspicious some of my kids friends are also using.  Overall excellent for my applications.On the down side the image quality of the camera and frame rates of the video are pretty weak, but plenty good for my needs. You have to upgrade to the $50/yr plan to really get everything out of the motion detection camera.  I am waiting on a upgrade that will allow the $80/yr plan to support up to three gateways so I can tie my two together.You can spend a lot more and get a lot more but if your applications are like mine it's a great overall system, main wish is that the camera resolution was better.

Reviews.Title: Bad System, Bad Deal
Reviews.Author: hcbloc
Reviews.Content: I bought this system early on when it was introduced.  Back then it was a great deal and touted itself as such.  Shell out $300 for the system and you could view it on your computer, your phone, your iPad and you could even take stills and record - no subscription fees!  But now, you pretty much have to pay for everything.  Unless you subscribe for the Premiere ($49/year) or Elite ($99/year) service you'll only be able to view on your computer and you can't have more than 2 cameras.Additionally, my system worked fine for about a year.  Since then, it's worked intermittently and finally stopped working at all.  Won't sync with the cameras.  The sync button is constantly stuck.  Cameras get duplicated online.  I emailed the company about all of this a few months ago and got absolutely no response.  Seems they really don't care if their product is faulty or if you find a solution to your problem.Cheap, plastic system.  Overpriced and under delivers.

Reviews.Title: Awesome. But...
Reviews.Author: R. Finlayson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for 2 purposes: keep an eye on the house while we are out of town (once we came back to a huge tree branch across our driveway) and as a monitor for my toddler. Got mine as an Amazon Lightening Deal for $129 (1 motion, 1 reg). Great price (like half retail, I think) for 2 cameras. It was VERY easy to set up and the Vuezone website viewing was a piece of a cake. Absolutely no problems with any of that. The cameras did occasionally have to be re "sync'd" which wouldn't be a problem if you're only using for baby monitor but proved unreliable for me, owing to the other reason for my purchase. How do you re-sync when out of town?Pros: extremely easy to set up; clear, nice live video via Vuezone website and via iphone app; motion detection worked well (emailed me when motion detected and took video that was stored on site).Cons: somewhat unreliable with sync issue (esp if you're not at physical site); iphone app only available with PAID subscription ($50 fiftydollars/year, I think, and this really bites considering other cams have free monitoring apps); no night viewing; no audio (as far as I can tell).In the end I purchased a set of D-Link livecams (DCS-932L) which have IR night view and audio for watching baby at night as well as free iphone and web viewing; they also have motion detection, email alerts, etc. The primary difference is that the Dlinks are IP cams and the vuezone are not. DLinks were moderately easy (I'd say level of difficulty for Vuezone was 1 and for DLink was 3 for basic, 5 for advanced settings). With IP cams, you have a lot more control, but this comes with the price of time and effort for maintaining control. I should add that I'm no techie. I'd say I've got your average mainstream, informed educ on computer issues.

Reviews.Title: VueZone - Easy and Simple Solution
Reviews.Author: Skyarrow "Mike R."
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a wireless video solution for my home for sometime. We have a senior with Dementia living in our home and we need to keep an eye on her. The had been looking at this product for sometime and with the new version, I think they have a very good product. It was easy to setup and you get a good video from these small IP cameras. The only issue I really have is the view angle is a bit small. I would like a more wide angle view on these cameras. I was hoping to 2 cameras would do the trick, but the view angle is so small, I am going to need 2 more just so I have everything available I was hoping for. Other future enhancements would be audio if possible. All in all, I think it is one of the best solutions for the money out there.

Now that we've got that out of the way...I'm pretty computer savvy but struggled for uncountable hours trying to get a Linksys network camera hooked up. Seriously, within 15 minutes of opening the box, the cams were up & running.The cams aren't lovely or small enough to hide easily. But they are nice looking & not huge. The fact that they are easily moved can be a double edged sword. It's nice to be able to move them around easily. But they can easily be knocked out of position if someone is cleaning the area or bumps into one. The kit came with two cams & four domes, so you can set up multiple placement domes to be used with the cameras. Plus, you can save the videos to your computer to keep forever and/or to free up space in your Vuezone account. If you download a clip to your computer, it's in a common, non-DRM protected format. This means you can easily modify the clip, if you have the tools & skill set.The downside is I dislike being locked into a service. Yes, I know there is the free service, but I think if you want videos, you have to have one of the pay subscriptions. However, after the struggles I had with trying to get the Linksys up & running, I figured it's probably worth it.I will update this post later, after more experience with the system.Update 9/15/11: A downside to the iPhone app is that you cannot set the motion detection time to 90 seconds, like you can in the web client. I did order two more cams - another motion detection one & another "regular" one.Update 10/2/11: From what I can see, you cannot have multiple cams recording at the same time. IOW, if you have two motion detection cams focused on the same area but from different angles, only the first one triggered will record.

Reviews.Title: MCameraX
Reviews.Author: jaybar
Reviews.Content: Excellent system for its purpose, like the motion feature. This is the best home camera I have seen but not for 7/24.Pros: easy to install, mobile (i can move each cameras, we have 4) anywhere in the house, excellent coverage of my home (3000 ft, 2 stories) and backyard, easy to operate, good/easy web and Android app, product is very beautifully designed.Cons: battery is not cheap, not 7/24.Recommendation: improve image quality even if its better than most WiFi cameras I have used before

Reviews.Title: Best system yet!
Reviews.Author: Edward Taussig "lemongrass"
Reviews.Content: This system really was as simple to set up and get working as they say it is,and has been reliable for me so far. I had no problem at all viewing a camera at the other end of my house from the gateway (through several walls), I did have tomove my gateway at least a foot away from my wireless router though.I love that the motion detection is -real- motion detection (works the same way an alarm system would detect motion via IR), most of the so-called detection schemes other netcams use are just an image motion detection algorithm that just isn't reliable, and that won't work at all in low light.Being able to place the small cameras anywhere is really cool.It's great having the iphone app too, it works well.Being able to have video clips recorded offsite when motion is detected is great for security purposes.The only drawbacks are that the frame rate is slower than other netcams (but that's not a real concern for me) and the biggest issue for me is that I cannot use the system from my work location, they did a great job making the gateway able to work without needing to open any ports on the router, but for some strange reason made the viewing web page dependent on how your network is set up,which means I'm unable to view the cameras most of the day, but to their credit, when I contacted their customer service about it, said they would consider trying to fix it.I'd also like to see other notification methods available for when motion is detected (e.g. SMS, instant message, or even an automated phone call...)I can't wait till the outdoor camera is available (hopefully it will have night-vision capability).

Reviews.Title: Overpriced fraudulent product than requires annual fee to use
Reviews.Author: Gene
Reviews.Content: -the camera itself is garbage. The images are very grainy and the frame rate is pitiful. I bought this because i had a break in and though a motion detection camera with off site record of anyone who enters would be worth the price. A price that is 10x the price of a much higher quality web-cam that in this day and age take far better images at great frame rates.-there is no powered option so if "wireless" is their big selling point -whats the point if the product is junk without more juice to run it.-requires an annual fee of 40-50 dollars to actually use the product in any real way. (ie. record or view on mobile device)-low light performance is pitiful.-resolution is pitiful and that is assuming you can see anything at all due to low frames causes nothing but blurry stuttered shots-no local recording option-vue zone servers crash constantly making your recorded clips unavailable for extended timesall in all, i'm very very disappointed in this purchase- stay away

Reviews.Title: Received USED Unit
Reviews.Author: rc "Adopt a shelter pet PetFinder."
Reviews.Content: Received this today and the box to me seemed not new. Opened it (didn't have a seal) and inside was a note seemingly written at the manufacturer that said to recheck unit because buyer reported that it was not connecting correctly.This low rating is for the manufacturer trying to slip used product into Amazon.com's new inventory.  Either that or something else happened.Anyway, Amazon.com CS gets 5 stars.  They resolved this unsatisfactory experience for me, and I will continue purchasing many a product from them in the future.Thanks Amazon.com!

Reviews.Title: VueZone software/app almost never works. Terrible experience
Reviews.Author: JLGTR "Bruce Gtr"
Reviews.Content: The cameras and the receiver work, however...The VueZone website and application are VERY POORLY BUILT.They crash and freeze all the time on iPhone, iPad, etc.Downloading the videos to your computer is another VERY FRUSTRATING EXPERIENCE!Even though the videos are recorded at VueZone servers, downloading them is something very frustrating, because the Vuezone website keeps disconnecting us every 20 seconds or so. Ridiculous.When it does not disconnect you, it stops your download at 2% or 3% progress. On average, every 20 tentatives, one download works and 19 fail. VERY POOR PERFORMANCE!VueZone,Fix your website and application.2 stars because, when the app works, we can really watch videos almost realtime. If it wasn't for that, I would have given 1 star.

Reviews.Title: When it works it's great
Reviews.Author: gtrhd
Reviews.Content: I purchaced the  Vue Zone system 2 years ago.When it works it's fine. But I've had to replace 2 cameras, 10 batteries and the Gateway. They all just died a few months after the warranty expired.It also needs to be  re synced constantly. I have it in my rental home 200 miles away.I'll check the batteries, sync it, get in my car and drive, several hours later it's not working. This has happened many times over the years.It's OK at home to watch the dogs, but the quality problems with the hardware are never ending.There is no other system like this, so I would buy it again, but I would not expect it to work when you really need it.

Reviews.Title: Hidden FEES Be CAREFUL
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: This is a RIP OFF!  I bought it and added cameras many times over the last two years, worked well.  One of the reasons I bought it was so that I could check in on my house and family while traveling.  The fact that I could use my Ipad and Iphone was the number one reason I bought it.  NOW!  Yu have to pay if you want to view on a mobile device.  This is a scam and they should be sued.  I am filing complaints with the US Attorney General's office.  I hope to get many more people that want their  money back.  I don't want 12 cameras that I have to pay to see thru my mobile device when that is not what IO was sold.  Even now there advertising is deceiving and fraudulent.  When you go to the app store nowhere does it say you have to pay for the service to view on a mobile device it makes it seem like it just works.  STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up and highly flexible system
Reviews.Author: Farnoosh Brock
Reviews.Content: The VueZone System was incredibly easy to set up; I just needed to create an account on the VueZone website, and plugged the system's main unit into my home network.  Within minutes I had powered on the two satellite cameras and had them visible though the VueZone website.  Note that all of the video from the cameras do flow back to the VueZone site, so this is not a system for keeping all of the video local to your home network.  The upside is that as long as you can reach the Vuezone website you can access your video feeds.  Using the free Vuezone app for the iPhone I was able to view my video from the office, the highway at 65mph and from another state with the same ease.Very simple to configure and install and very flexible in watching the video.  Highly recommended, as long as you are ok with your video feeds passing through the VueZone website.

Reviews.Title: Awful system
Reviews.Author: skullyspice
Reviews.Content: This system is terrible. do not waste your money on it like I did. I have the 2 camera system. The cameras freeze up every 30 seconds and rebooting them takes several minutes, so I usually miss what I am trying to see. They are perfectly within range, 20-30 feet from the base station. great idea, but it just doesnt work. I would hate for someone to buy this that really needed to keep an eye on something or someone, because it is not for that. I got it to check in on my dog walkers which means I need it to work for 5 minutes a day and it is absolutely useless to me because I end up missing it while the cameras are frozen!

Reviews.Title: No customer service+poor out of box usability=waste of $$$
Reviews.Author: Ryan S Easley
Reviews.Content: Contacted (tried to contact) no service! Tried to use, it's a joke... Collecting dust! Looking for a system that works to do basic monitoring, the features I will be looking for will be A/C option (vue zone is battery based) and wi-fi link up (not RF like vue zone product). Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: Mobile app used to work great until ICS 4.0
Reviews.Author: NatenSD "1080p Guy"
Reviews.Content: *UPDATE* September 12, 2012App is updated to work with Android ICS 4.0.4 - changed star rating back to 4 stars - it is a really good product and I highly recommend purchasing it for peace-of-mind if you spend alot of time away from home*******************************************************************************************************************************What a frustrating ordeal!  I travel every week and loved having the peace of mind of being able to access the cameras with my mobile, until I upgraded my android to ICS 4.0.4 and the app stopped working.  Contacted Avaak and they were completely clueless!!! Ugh! They then said "try downloading the app in about a year"!!!!  Really?  In this high tech environment they cant keep up?  Time to buy the easyN system and cancel my Vuezone account.  My $450 dollar investment is completely useless to me!!!

Reviews.Title: VueZone System Remote Viewing- Garage Cam
Reviews.Author: RPG "R"
Reviews.Content: Wanted to make sure my babies are all good while at work or sleep..  I have outside premises Cams.  But, wanted to get a trigger cam inside my garage.. this VueZone cam works GReat!! Mind you this is an unattached garage by the brownstone.. works really well as you can see.  might have to buy more cams...  well worth the price & so easy to set up... check out my youtube video..[...]VueZone System with 1 Indoor Motion Detection Camera (SM2200)

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: JXC
Reviews.Content: A great buy and great product so glad i bought the system. Would be nice to have a window sticker to discourage would be theifs too as that is a major factor touted by anti-theft companies.

Reviews.Title: Cannot use without a paid service plan
Reviews.Author: J. Mootz
Reviews.Content: The Amazon description for this product is incorrect.  It states the basic plan is free but you must pay a yearly fee. You only get a one month before you have to pay for the service. And the worst part is you are not told that the basic service plan is not free until you create an on-line account during the set-up process.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Mark F. Debelack
Reviews.Content: Product would not connect to my network out of the box.  I called product support, and they were insistant it was a problem with my router, even though I tried multiple ports, which all connected with other devices without issue.  I'm now waiting for Technical Support to call me back.

Reviews.Title: Vue Zone Support is Awful
Reviews.Author: Daniel O. Dickinson
Reviews.Content: I have purchased several cameras and gateways over the last 3 years to set up at different locations.  In order to do this I have had to set up different E-Mail accounts for each location.  No problem, unless you want to change gateways or put cameras from one gateway to another.  When a Gateway is "registered" to an E-Mail each camera is registered to that gateway. So once the camera and gateway is registered it is IMPOSSIBLE to mix and match.  I spent over 1.5 Hours on their customer service line trying to de-register the gateways and cameras so I could start over again.  I finally gave up.  I am going to send the new gateways and cameras back to them. I can't deal with this.  If you keep the cameras at the same gateway for ever you might be OK.  But if you ever move them around you are out of luck.  I cannot deal with these people any longer

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Kingrich
Reviews.Content: I have had the system for over a year.  It works about 70% of the time.  Without warning I will get a Gateway error or can't find the camera error.  Can not recommend - very unreliable.

Reviews.Title: Did Not Work On My Business LAN
Reviews.Author: David Gurgel
Reviews.Content: This system would not install at my small business because of proxy server or firewall issues. The VueZone installation guide suggests that installation may fail where Internet access is via a proxy server.

Reviews.Title: Vuezone system would not stay connected for more than a minute.
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "On the Mississippi River"
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 hours with tech support attempting to get a system with 2 motion detected cameras to work.  And each time tech support was able to establish the connection, then saying goodbye, the cameras would disconnect.  and let me point out a few facts.  My internet connection is 35mps verizon fios.  I was doing the entire setup in my office so the cameras were within a few feet of the transmitter that was connected to my fios router.  I spent a total of 3+ hours in 4 different conversations to get the cameras to stay connected and they would not stay connected.  I gave up in the end as there's no reason to buy something like this and it not work out of the box.  and yes, all the batteries were tested and were strong. very disappointed in this system and frankly I don't understand all the positive comments on this hardware. and to think that I didn't even dare move the cameras to the parts of my house I wanted to use them.  very strange indeed. so if anyone wants to buy the system from me, pls contact me at mmgibbons@farinc.com

Reviews.Title: Very cool device, and AMAZING customer service
Reviews.Author: AdDesigns
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool device. Although a little tricky to set up, their customer service was OUTSTANDING. They were very nice, patient and walked me through setting it up even through my computer! The security is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Crappy product
Reviews.Author: Jn
Reviews.Content: Think of a playskool type child monitor. Very poor quality, poor website.Frame rate really slow and shuts off by itself.They won't return your subscription money.The 30 day guarantee isn't a full refund like you think.Recommend not buying

Reviews.Title: Almost great, but good value for money
Reviews.Author: Gordon Sprague "Flash.CO"
Reviews.Content: Picked it up on a lightning deal for 50% off.  For the money I am really pleased.  The frame rate could be better but it works for my application.  Will upgrade to more camera's when I can pick them up on sale.

Reviews.Title: THEIR SERVICE GOES DOWN FOR "MAINTENANCE" -- not allowing you to access your cameras!
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: BUYER BEWARE! -- I'm trying to access my cameras tonight, but their website (as well as the smartphone app) say their SITE IS DOWN FOR MAINTENANCE.So, ask yourself, how would you feel if you bought a surveillance system, and had a one-year subscription to the premium service, as well, and were NOT ABLE TO SEE THE SURVEILLANCE, randomly!?!?THIS IS A JOKE.  Not to mention a fraud???*** I encourage anyone who bought this product, and who is having problems, to report them to the Better Business Bureau ***

Reviews.Title: So Dissappointed.
Reviews.Author: L. Johnston
Reviews.Content: I kept this thing to long so I couldn't send it back, but the disconnects were and still are very frustrating.  Don't buy.

Reviews.Title: A Subscription to Battery Eating
Reviews.Author: J. Sheldon Cooper "Conspicuous Consumer"
Reviews.Content: For the Lightning Deal price ~$135, I thought this had promise, but you soon learn the free part gives you zip. If you want recording, motion sensor use, or alerting functions, you need to move up a tier or two.Add to that whenever a camera is on, batteries are draining rapidly. I think they estimate several months...... if you only have the camera 5 minutes a day. Really, how long do you need to watch the babysitter screwing her boyfriend?Also forget about remote rebooting, or reliable connections.And you don't actually connect to the cameras, you connect to their servers. Who knows what troglodytic employee is gaping at active video streams? And if VueZone goes out of business, so do you. And of course they "reserve the right".....If you haven't guessed, mine went right back to Amazon (thank goodness for their liberal return policy).Very dissatisfying purchase.

Reviews.Title: unreliable, unresponsive, unprofessional
Reviews.Author: vwl
Reviews.Content: I purchased a VueZone system with 2 cameras in Aug 2012. Within 3 months, 3 times the cameras were not available for watching. Each time the cameras mysteriously came back to live after a few days. Interrupted service should be posted on the home-page, and tech support should not waste customers' time by asking them to read FAQs, even when VueZone knows the problems result from its own technical issues.Four days ago when I tried to logon to my account, I got a "stack trace" dump.
